scene_startbuff_enter.title: Operation Rewards
scene_startbuff_enter.description: You overcame at least two floors in your last exploration. You'll be able to receive more assistance this time.

scene_treasure1_enter.title: Gift of History
scene_treasure1_enter.description: An old city once perished in a tragedy, and the tragic tale of the citizens' tribulations has been weaved into a play. While their story continues to be told, the treasures of the city have laid dormant until now. You come across some treasures next to the rotten corpse of the story's protagonist. The most precious manuscript, penned by the star herself, is half rotted and lost among the dust.

scene_treasure1_1.title: Gift of History
scene_treasure1_1.description: No one can say for certain whether the script came first or the actual events. As a memento, you pick a treasure from the pile.

scene_treasure2_enter.title: Gift of Fate
scene_treasure2_enter.description: You cannot say for certain whether this is reality or merely a dream, but there is a tall stone pedestal with an expensive, old-fashioned looking box on top. Perhaps someone left it here, or perhaps it has been waiting here for you. Regardless, it is a gift.

scene_treasure2_1.title: Gift of Fate
scene_treasure2_1.description: If your life was a play, would it be a comedy or a tragedy?

scene_rest_enter.title: Safe House
scene_rest_enter.description: There is danger lying in wait in every corner of the old castle. The unusual environment, the enemies lurking in the shadows, and the grotesque happenings have been unceasing, wearing you and your squad out. Fortunately, you are able to find a corner to catch a breather every now and then. You would do well to manage your resources, relax, and plan your next steps quickly. Your next challenge will appear before long.

scene_rest_1.title: Safe House
scene_rest_1.description: Here, you can relax and sleep undisturbed. The longer you rest, the more stamina you will have to fend off enemies who come attacking.

scene_rest_2.title: Safe House
scene_rest_2.description: The difficulties that lie ahead are unpredictable, and so we must hone our abilities.

scene_rest_3.title: Safe House
scene_rest_3.description: Your party has witnessed many strange phenomena, but when you recount the epics of the past heroes, everyone nonetheless gathers round to listen.

scene_rest_4.title: Safe House
scene_rest_4.description: You take inventory of your resources and find that, when the resources are rationed appropriately, you have enough resources for more pairs of hands.

scene_ent1_enter.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_enter.description: The tiny stage in the corner of the hall attracts your attention. You walk closer to find that there is already a knight on the stage. The performance is almost ready to begin, pending just one more character gracing the stage. Where is the character? You look at the coin slot to the side.

scene_ent1_1.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_1.description: The curtain falls, and the characters all leave the stage one by one, but after a period of silence, the curtain rises again with the lone knight on the stage, just as before.

scene_ent1_2.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_2.description: A beggar walks onto the stage, motioning to the knight in seek of alms. The knight tosses a coin. It tumbles onto the ground, drawing a circle in its path before toppling off the stage.

scene_ent1_3.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_3.description: A lady walks onto the stage. The knight takes out a bouquet of Originium clusters and proposes to her. She refuses. The knight, seemingly dejected, tosses the Originium clusters off the stage.

scene_ent1_4.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_4.description: A clown walks onto the stage and performs many tricks for the knight. The knight seems happy, and so do you.

scene_ent1_5.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_5.description: A king walks onto the stage. The knight kneels before him and presents to his king a prized treasure. The king takes the treasure and flings it off the stage indifferently.

scene_ent1_6.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_6.description: Another knight walks onto the stage. The two immediately exchange blows. In the end, both knights collapse, and you gain nothing.

scene_ent1_7.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_7.description: You've waited a long time, but nothing happens. Just as you're starting to grow irritated, the knight suddenly explodes, revealing an Originium core inside. There will be no more performances.

scene_ent1_8.title: A Tiny Stage
scene_ent1_8.description: The plays performed on the stage are all the same. You have lost interest in them, but you are suddenly reminded of some historical records you once read. The crude stage play being performed before your eyes seems very similar to a certain historical event.

scene_ent2_enter.title: Curio Keeper
scene_ent2_enter.description: You come across an old lady sitting on top of a tall pile of boxes, reading fairy tales. She notices you, and beckons you toward her. According to her, all these were once treasures, but their owner lost everything he ever had and was forgotten by history, leaving not so much as a gravestone. Thus, all the curios became 'junk' without owners. If you're willing to spend some coins and listen to the old lady tell the tale of this box's owner, you will become its new owner.

scene_ent2_1.title: Curio Keeper
scene_ent2_1.description: You ask the old lady where she heard all these stories. She thinks to herself and, with a smile, she tells you she has a Caprinae granddaughter, and she heard all the stories from her granddaughter. The old lady is a Feline. Subconsciously, you think she may be hiding something, but the truth is you find the story decent, and what's inside the box might come in handy. After some small talk, the old lady asks if you would like to hear another story.

scene_ent2_2.title: Curio Keeper
scene_ent2_2.description: The old lady tells a colorful tale of adventure. Alas, the hero of the tale ends up walking a path of no return. You open the box to find a useful tool inside.

scene_ent2_3.title: Curio Keeper
scene_ent2_3.description: The old lady tells the story of a child of a poor family who dreams of becoming an actor, only to go missing after joining a troupe. You open the box to find some rusks inside.

scene_ent2_4.title: Curio Keeper
scene_ent2_4.description: The old lady sees that you are not very interested in listening to any more stories and returns to her book without saying more. As you leave, you notice the letters on the book's cover written in Victorian: Geoffrey's New Fairy Tales

scene_ent3_enter.title: Potent Potables
scene_ent3_enter.description: At a wine cellar, you come across a few Durins in a drinking contest. The castle's centuries-old collection of fine wine is being squandered lavishly, yet they claim they have the permission of the collection's owner. Seeing that you are here, they roll a barrel of fine wine toward you and invite you to join in on the fun.

scene_ent3_1.title: Potent Potables
scene_ent3_1.description: You are doing decently, as an enterprising heavy drinker. As you drink from the barrel, the Durins cheer and toss some coins your way.

scene_ent3_2.title: Potent Potables
scene_ent3_2.description: Look at you. You could pass for a real Durin with your ability to down alcohol. The Durins are having fun, and they give you a few gifts for your efforts.

scene_ent3_3.title: Potent Potables
scene_ent3_3.description: The Durins marvel in awe at how you finished an entire barrel in one go. 'That's the vintage the leader of that troupe has kept for 500 years!' They exclaim and show their respect for you with applause and treasure.

scene_ent3_4.title: Potent Potables
scene_ent3_4.description: The Durins will stay until the cellar is completely devoid of liquor, but it is time for you to take your leave. You still have other things to attend to.

scene_ent4_enter.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_enter.description: You wander aimlessly in the castle. By accident, you step on a rotten patch of the flooring and fall into the castle's basement. Here, you find a heap of garbage as well as three doleful-looking Zalaks. The Zalaks confess that they are treasure hunters who have painstakingly searched for the castle's treasure chamber, only to find that someone has been here before them. The chamber has nothing but a pile of trash left.

scene_ent4_1.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_1.description: 'There is still something valuable here?' The Zalaks look at you, confused.

scene_ent4_2.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_2.description: You find a rare artifact. The Zalaks look at you, surprised.

scene_ent4_3.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_3.description: You find a huge chest full of food. The Zalaks look at you, drooling.

scene_ent4_4.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_4.description: You find a chest full of Originium Ingots. The Zalaks look at you jealously.

scene_ent4_5.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_5.description: You find a sack of food. The Zalaks gulp their saliva.

scene_ent4_6.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_6.description: You find a few pieces of Originium Ingots. The three Zalaks' eyes light up.

scene_ent4_7.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_7.description: You go through the heap of trash, but only come out covered in dust, completely empty-handed.

scene_ent4_8.title: The Rat Thieves
scene_ent4_8.description: Let's not waste any more time here.

scene_hp_enter.title: Camp
scene_hp_enter.description: You find a quiet corner safe enough to harbor your entire squad from harm, allowing you to rest and reorganize. Having helped your teammates settle in, your consciousness slowly begins to loosen up.

scene_hp_1.title: Camp
scene_hp_1.description: By the time you open your eyes again, your anxiety and exhaustion have long departed your body. You gather up your bags and continue exploring the unknown with your teammates.

scene_gold_enter.title: The Kind Puppet
scene_gold_enter.description: A worn-out wooden puppet sits next to the wall, its limbs almost falling apart. Its hazy facial features seem to ring a bell, but you cannot say for certain who it is given how worn-out it is. You come close to the puppet and find that there seems to be something hidden inside its chest.

scene_gold_1.title: The Kind Puppet
scene_gold_1.description: You pry open its chest and find a fire-red heart. You obtain a beautiful gem, the heart of the puppet.

scene_population_enter.title: Teller of Tales
scene_population_enter.description: You sit next to a simple campfire at the castle's terrace, trying to get some rest. Next to you sits a special passerby. The talkative adventurer has shared with you many over-the-top stories: 'I heard the Columbian president is actually a machine...' 'I've been told that there are some slowly moving mountain ranges in the Fjal Vetrtonn of Sami...' 'Some people say there are some twisted experiments being run behind the scenes of the endless war in Bolívar. Those scary things they call Hounds were actually created in those experiments...'

scene_population_1.title: Teller of Tales
scene_population_1.description: We all know the world of Terra is full of strange legends, but these stories are a little too far-fetched. They can't be real, can they?

scene_recruit1_enter.title: Adventurer Commission
scene_recruit1_enter.description: You come across a wandering adventurer. He tells you about some strange happenings he came upon lately. Supposedly, there have is some grandiose supernatural playhouse with phantoms partying hard on the stage each and every night. His search has proven to be futile, and he was almost attacked by a group of madmen spouting nonsense. He is preparing to leave now, and perhaps we can entrust to him a request for help from our allies waiting outside.

scene_recruit1_1.title: Adventurer Commission
scene_recruit1_1.description: You take out a few ancient coins you found during your exploration and place them in the adventurer's hand. He smiles and promises to pass on your message.

scene_recruit1_2.title: Adventurer Commission
scene_recruit1_2.description: Sincerity can move the hearts of many. You are too sincere, and the adventurer is truly touched by this. He even asks you for your contact information, telling you he looks forward to working with you again.

scene_recruit1_3.title: Adventurer Commission
scene_recruit1_3.description: The adventurer gives you his word, but no one comes to your aid, no matter how long you wait.

scene_recruit2_enter.title: 'Royal Rumble'
scene_recruit2_enter.description: In a strange, frivolously decorated room, there are two extravagantly dressed Liberi, both with crowns on their head, locked in a fiery standoff. They claim to be the sixth and eighth emperor of Gaul, and they are debating the achievements and missteps of Corsica I, the last emperor of Gaul. Their debate is getting out of hand, and things are about to come to blows.

scene_recruit2_1.title: 'Royal Rumble'
scene_recruit2_1.description: You denounce Corsica I, claiming that he was the culprit who led to the downfall of the Gaulish Empire, and criticize his stubbornness and recklessness. One of the emperors agrees with your assessment and rewards you with something precious. Afterwards, the two disappear into the mist.

scene_recruit2_2.title: 'Royal Rumble'
scene_recruit2_2.description: You sing the praises of Corsica I, claiming that he was among Gaul's greatest emperors, and although the country fell under his rule, no one is perfect. Both emperors agree that you have a point and reward you with a large amount of treasures. Afterwards, the two disappear into the mist.

scene_up1_enter.title: Advance Squad
scene_up1_enter.description: You locate the Rhodes Island squad who sent out the original distress signal. They have been scouting the surrounding areas before you made contact. You exchange information with each other, and their squad shares some of their resources and experience with you.

scene_up1_1.title: Advance Squad
scene_up1_1.description: You have learned much from the squad, and it is time to continue your exploration.

scene_up2_enter.title: Gaulish Veteran
scene_up2_enter.description: You happen upon an old, veteran soldier in tattered clothing who's sitting on top of the castle's ruins. You chat with him a little and learn about his past. The man claims to be a Gaulish Vanguard who once fought alongside the emperor. He is here to seek the emperor's treasures to contribute to Gaul's revival. As your conversation continues, the man starts an impassioned speech, impressing upon you his homeland's past glory.

scene_up2_1.title: Gaulish Veteran
scene_up2_1.description: Even so, you take a closer look at the old soldier's uniform and realizes he might simply be a drafted militiaman of the Gaulish Empire. He even mispronounced the emperor's name. You choose not to point that out, though. After the old soldier finishes his speech, he gives you many supplies to show his appreciation for how attentive you were.

scene_trade1_enter.title: Hallucinatory Candlelights
scene_trade1_enter.description: In the center part of the castle, you find a chapel enveloped by a cloud of haze. There is a sweet, yet strange smell wafting from the chapel. The smell seems to originate from the countless scented candles inside the chapel. You notice what seems to be some treasures sitting on the chapel's lectern.

scene_trade1_1.title: Hallucinatory Candlelights
scene_trade1_1.description: The thick smell leaves you lightheaded, but you manage to bear with it and make it outside. You realize that there are many places in the castle where these strange scented candles are lit, and that explains why many of the people here in the castle seem fairly unstable.

scene_trade1_2.title: Hallucinatory Candlelights
scene_trade1_2.description: Let's not give ourselves any trouble.

scene_trade2_enter.title: Columbian Brewer
scene_trade2_enter.description: You see a group of adventurers and treasure hunters having a good time over beer. Next to them are a few Columbians selling large amounts of beer. You talk to them and learn that they work for a small Columbian brewery whose delivery truck was damaged in a Catastrophe, and they opted to sell their wares to any passing visitors.

scene_trade2_1.title: Columbian Brewer
scene_trade2_1.description: You take a close look at the beer in your hand. It reads, 'Bob Farms Originium Slug Brew.' The name feels familiar to you.

scene_trade2_2.title: Columbian Brewer
scene_trade2_2.description: Now isn't the time to drink.

scene_trade3_enter.title: 'Tin Man'
scene_trade3_enter.description: You come across a strange man wearing a trench coat. His face, shadowed by the large fedora he is wearing, is composed of metallic, mechanical parts. He claims to be a detective hired by the 'Maylander Historical Association' to investigate the mysterious organization, 'Crimson Troupe.' However, like you, he is trapped here now. You realize you might be able to share information with each other.

scene_trade3_1.title: 'Tin Man'
scene_trade3_1.description: 'As far as I've uncovered, the Crimson Troupe is an assassination agency with hitmen masquerading as performers. A few years ago, one of the troupe's members, codename Solitaire, murdered a few of the organization's leaders, and the Crimson Troupe fell apart soon after. Sadly, all that has happened here in this castle shows that this organization was never truly destroyed. They are still bringing death and suffering to the innocent.' After he shares this information with you, the detective hands you some supplies.

scene_trade3_2.title: 'Tin Man'
scene_trade3_2.description: 'I wish you the best of luck.' The tin detective bids his farewell and disappears down the hallway. Speaking of which, what race was he anyway?

scene_exchange_enter.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_enter.description: A truly bustling masquerade. There are countless dancers wearing full dresses and masks around. They waltz past you as the accompanying pieces of enthusiastic music echo throughout the hall one after another. None of them feel the slightest bit of exhaustion even when their voices go hoarse. None of them are stopping even when their shoes are completely worn out and their feet bleeding. You can't see their faces as all of them are wearing masks that feign happiness.

scene_exchange_1.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_1.description: You feel terrified among the joyous crowd and want to leave as soon as possible.

scene_exchange_2.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_2.description: You feel your outfit is not very well-suited for the occasion. The first step to blending in is to dress the part.

scene_exchange_3.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_3.description: You give a dancer your most sincere compliments. She smiles at you the moment she takes the flower and puts it in her chest pocket.

scene_exchange_4.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_4.description: Dance! Dance! This ball may be endless, but so what? You feel truly alive right now!

scene_exchange_5.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_5.description: You start to sing freely on a whim, and the accompanying music begin to follow your every rhythm. 'The leader would love your singing. He definitely would.' The dancers stop and watch on in silence.

scene_exchange_6.title: Crimson Masquerade
scene_exchange_6.description: What do they look like behind the masks? You break the greatest taboo of masquerades, and with the mask in your hand, you are certain that this is a decision that you will come to regret.

scene_1_enter.title: Theatrical Necessities
scene_1_enter.description: You find a middle-aged man rambling away in front of a dressing table. He notices you and howls in your direction, asking you to deliver the prop on the table to the actress. You look at the dressing table and find a crown entwined with thorns.

scene_1_1.title: Theatrical Necessities
scene_1_1.description: You cut your fingers when you reach your hand out for the crown. You let go immediately, dropping the crown to the floor and shattering it in half. The middle-aged man is just about to yell at you but turns around all of a sudden. You hear something. The man scratches his ear. Apparently the actress no longers want to play the queen and has run away. He trots away shortly afterwards. With the charade over, you pick up the intact half-crown, now freed from its thorny enclosure.

scene_1_2.title: Theatrical Necessities
scene_1_2.description: You ignore the middle-aged man's howlings and leave.

scene_2_enter.title: Dancing Mad
scene_2_enter.description: You happen upon a Sarkaz lady wearing a mask and red dance shoes. She dances alone in the open space, and, noticing you, she reaches her hand out, inviting you to dance with her.

scene_2_1.title: Dancing Mad
scene_2_1.description: The two of you share a dance and enjoy your time together. Before you part ways, the lady gifts you a pair of dance shoes based on the form of dance at which you are most skilled. You take the shoes from her, and just as you are about to thank her, you realize she is nowhere to be seen. You reach into your pockets and notice that something seems to be missing.

scene_2_2.title: Dancing Mad
scene_2_2.description: Noticing your refusal, the lady ignores you and returns to dancing alone.

scene_3_enter.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_enter.description: You hear a beautiful melody. A wandering jazz player claims to be seeking a legend in the history of art. He traced the troupe's footsteps and made his way here in hopes of joining them. If you would like, he could write a song for you right now. Of course, his troubles demand a small tip.

scene_3_1.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_1.description: He racks his brain to come up with a few words. It seems inspiration hasn't quite hit him yet.

scene_3_2.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_2.description: He racks his brain to come up with a few words. It seems inspiration hasn't quite hit him yet.

scene_3_3.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_3.description: He racks his brain to come up with a few words. It seems inspiration hasn't quite hit him yet.

scene_3_4.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_4.description: He racks his brain to come up with a few words. It seems inspiration hasn't quite hit him yet.

scene_3_5.title: Musical Challenge
scene_3_5.description: He mutters for a moment and strums his instrument. He admits that he is unable to fulfill his promise, and he has finally had a taste of failure thanks to you. As such, he offers you a gift.

scene_4_enter.title: 'The Sword in the Stone'
scene_4_enter.description: You stumble on a knight wearing a worn-out set of armor and gloomily looking at a sword in a stone. He claims to be a knight journeying in search of the holy sword, and he must bring this sword back to his kingdom to become its rightful ruler. However, he has no way to pull out the sword from the stone.

scene_4_1.title: 'The Sword in the Stone'
scene_4_1.description: You rack your brain to come up with a solution. In the end, you smash the sword in two. Seeing half of the sword still stuck in the stone, the knight lets out a long sigh, shakes his head, and leaves.

scene_4_2.title: 'The Sword in the Stone'
scene_4_2.description: Taking your advice, the knight attempts to lift the sword, the stone still attached. Unable to keep his balance, he trips and falls on the ground head first, knocking himself unconscious.

scene_4_3.title: 'The Sword in the Stone'
scene_4_3.description:
'Strange stones lying in forts distributing swords is no basis for a system of government. Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical geologic ceremony.'
The knight thinks you have a point and leaves on a satisfied note.

scene_5_enter.title: Trapped Man
scene_5_enter.description: A youthful looking Feline man is hiding under a long table for some reason. Whenever someone comes close, he starts murmuring in an almost frightening way. He insists on staying under the table, but after much work on your part, he believes you are not a ghost here to kidnap him for performances and songs. He is even willing to trade his only treasure with you.

scene_5_1.title: Trapped Man
scene_5_1.description: This might be worth it. Perhaps...

scene_5_2.title: Trapped Man
scene_5_2.description: What treasures could he have anyway? Okay, okay. As long as you get out from under the table!

scene_6_enter.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_enter.description: 'I know who it is that you seek, outsider,' says a slender, stooped woman with a strange laugh. 'You don't understand that Feline, do you? You seem to trust him, though.' The strange woman looks at you through her helmet and scarf. 'I can tell you all about his past. Are you interested?' She reaches out her shriveled hands, seemingly asking for something.

scene_6_1.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_1.description: 'As a member of the troupe, he was very well trained. 'Shadow' taught him illusion Arts. 'Bladedance' taught him his dance-like combat techniques. 'Whiteflower' taught him his exquisite acting skills. As for His Lordship, he gave him his charming singing voice... When the Feline finally learned the truth and realized his respected teachers were all hopeless villains... What a long, bloody night it was...'

scene_6_2.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_2.description: 'Ah, 'Shadow.' A most delicate but cruel murderer. He was a villain who lurked in the shadows. Alas, his student evidently knew how to blend into the darkness even better than he.'

scene_6_3.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_3.description: 'Ah, the beautiful dancer. Sharp as a blade, and cold as a blizzard. Too bad, then, that the young Feline was swifter. I thought they were on very good terms. How regrettable.'

scene_6_4.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_4.description: 'Oh, 'Whiteflower.' Hahaha. The woman was a fine actor, but her performance could never hide what a vicious, despicable person she was. Dying at the hands of her own student was a fate too kind. Hahahaha.'

scene_6_5.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_5.description: 'How could be so brave as to ask about him? What a reckless lunatic. For your fearlessness, I will give you your money back, but I don't want to die yet. I can't tell you anything.'

scene_6_7.title: Eccentric Hunchback
scene_6_7.description: This is too sketchy. Forget it.

scene_bat1_enter.title: Sleeping Statue
scene_bat1_enter.description: By mistake, you barge into a large, empty hall. The hall is packed with all kinds of stone statues, dressed in different outfits. The statues stand in different poses, and their details are eerily lifelike. You notice that all of the statues have their eyes closed as though sleeping.

scene_bat1_1.title: Sleeping Statue
scene_bat1_1.description: 'Awaken! Rouse from your slumber!' The chance to say things like this doesn't come by often, and even though there may be a dear price to pay, there will always be some who thinks it's worth it.

scene_bat1_2.title: Sleeping Statue
scene_bat1_2.description: Let's not disturb the sleeping statues, especially when they have gathered here in such large numbers. You heed the advice you received before and quietly head for the door.

scene_bat2_enter.title: Shackled Bloodline
scene_bat2_enter.description: In a dark jail, you find a slender girl shackled to a stone column by multiple chains. Noticing you, the girl claims to be a member of the Sarkaz Vampire royal family. She asks you to give her a little blood to restore her strength and break free from her restraints.

scene_bat2_1.title: Shackled Bloodline
scene_bat2_1.description: After a loud roar, the girl rips the thick chains apart and laugh manically. She loudly ridicules the 'Troupe' who locked her here and swears to take revenge against every last one of them. Her fine facial features suddenly crumble into three segments, revealing her sharp, horrifying fangs. Subsequently, the shadows in the jail morph into several human-like shapes, and the twisted beings all attack you at once.

scene_bat2_2.title: Shackled Bloodline
scene_bat2_2.description: Seeing you walk away indifferently, the shackled girl lets out a terrifying scream. You are thankful that you didn't stick your hand where it doesn't belong.

scene_bat3_enter.title: Phantom Ramblings
scene_bat3_enter.description: As you explore the long corridor, an eerie voice suddenly speaks to you: 'Your actions in Kazimierz have piqued my interest, which is why I prepared a wonderful encounter for you right here. Would you be so kind to take part in a knight duel performance with my actors?' Not a second after the voice finishes, four knights step out of the shadows. Though they look familiar, you can feel that they are not anyone you are acquainted with.

scene_bat3_1.title: Phantom Ramblings
scene_bat3_1.description: 'It matters not who reigns victorious in the end. Your participation has given our dull program an uplifting improvement. You have my thanks, dear traveler from afar.'

scene_bat3_2.title: Phantom Ramblings
scene_bat3_2.description: Noticing that you are not responding to his request, the voice lets out a sigh, and the four knights fall back into the shadows, never to be seen again.

scene_bat4_enter.title: Art and Madness
scene_bat4_enter.description: 'They're nuts! They're all nuts! Help!' You hear a loud plea for help through the door. At the same time, you notice a sweet, strange aroma wafting in the air.

scene_bat4_1.title: Art and Madness
scene_bat4_1.description: You open the door and find yourself immediately bombarded by the strong aroma. A large group of well-dressed artists are engaged in a bloodbath inside the house, all of them delirious. There are already many bodies lying dead on the floor. Soon, they will be attacking you.

scene_bat4_2.title: Art and Madness
scene_bat4_2.description: It's better not to look for trouble. Let's walk away.

scene_t1_enter.title: Duck Lord the Lead Actor?
scene_t1_enter.description: The curtain rises before you, and you are the only members of the audience today. Tonight's performance is a renowned Gaulish tragicomedy. Its talented female lead even danced till her shoes were soaked with blood during a curtain call one time as the audience cheered her on—Hey, what the duck? Why is there's a duck scattering cash around the stage?

scene_t1_1.title: Duck Lord the Lead Actor?
scene_t1_1.description: Infuriated, you stomp onto the stage, hell bent on getting this duck off the stage!

scene_t1_2.title: Duck Lord the Lead Actor?
scene_t1_2.description: Surprisingly, the duck's steps aren't too bad.

scene_t2_enter.title: Duck Lord's Party
scene_t2_enter.description: The duck, apparently called the Duck Lord, invites you to a party. The entire table is packed full of the finest beverages and most decadent desserts Gaul has to offer. The other guests sitting at the table are also chatting away about various artistic subjects. Suddenly, the duck snaps his fingers, and everyone falls silent. 'I know why all of you are here, friends,' the duck says. 'I suggest you all go home while you still have the chance.'

scene_t2_1.title: Duck Lord's Party
scene_t2_1.description: Naturally, you aren't about to listen to a duck's quackings, but it seems he has some inside information—You decide to capture him!

scene_t2_2.title: Duck Lord's Party
scene_t2_2.description: You persuade the artists gathered here that this isn't a nice place to be.

scene_t3_enter.title: Duck Lord's Improv
scene_t3_enter.description: You come across the duck who calls himself the Duck Lord once again. He is harshly mocking a puppet, which he claims to be an improvised performance. The program's title is 'How Investors Mock Investees.' You take a closer look and notice that a picture of the famous Columbian rapper Emperor is nailed to the puppet.

scene_t3_1.title: Duck Lord's Improv
scene_t3_1.description: You are about to argue with him. The stalwart Ursus man behind him nods and raises his fist.

scene_t3_2.title: Duck Lord's Improv
scene_t3_2.description: This might just be how the rich live, though you are nonetheless curious about this duck's relation to Emperor.

scene_t4_enter.title: About That Ursus Man
scene_t4_enter.description: In the corner of a rundown storeroom lies a large amount of Ursus military uniforms and weapons. You notice a familiar figure. The stalwart Ursus man who usually follows the Duck Lord around is crouched on the ground with a melancholic look. Every now and then, he takes a peek at the photograph in his hand. You steal a glance and realize it's a photograph of the Ursus man in uniform and a Hippogryph general.

scene_t4_1.title: About That Ursus Man
scene_t4_1.description: You ignore the Ursus man and start flipping through the boxes and shelves in the room. Your rude behavior angers him, and he picks up a weapon beside him to attack you.

scene_t4_2.title: About That Ursus Man
scene_t4_2.description: Everyone goes through ups and downs, and everyone has moments they find difficult to look back on.

scene_blood1_enter.title: Coffin of Evil
scene_blood1_enter.description: You discover a dark room deep inside the castle. There are no windows in the room, nor are there any light sources. In the center of the room is a massive coffin with many gems and jewels affixed. Just as you are about to inspect the coffin, you hear a voice from inside it. It seems to be asking for your help to open the coffin.

scene_blood1_1.title: Coffin of Evil
scene_blood1_1.description: The coffin was nailed shut. Your only way to free its occupant is to pry it open. An attractive-looking Liberi man climbs out of the coffin. Kindness is always rewarded, and he gives you a gift as thanks.

scene_blood1_2.title: Coffin of Evil
scene_blood1_2.description: In many stories, those who offer others help often find their kindness backfiring. Being the cautious person you are, you ignore the suspicious pleas. You even take the jewels on the coffin with you and close the door on your way out.

scene_blood2_enter.title: Eye For an Eye
scene_blood2_enter.description: A refined, well-dressed Sarkaz gentleman stands before you. He politely asks if you know of an innocent man who was once wrongfully punished because of him. You ask him to elaborate and learn that, because of a mistake he made, the villagers all mistook his friend for a Vampire and locked him here. The man promises a sizable reward if you lend him your help.

scene_blood2_1.title: Eye For an Eye
scene_blood2_1.description: You tell him his friend has already been freed. The news is most encouraging, and the gentleman promises to reward you.

scene_blood2_2.title: Eye For an Eye
scene_blood2_2.description: He gives you his thanks and explains the whole story to you on your way there. However, in the end, he implores you not to ask the villagers what happened thereafter.

scene_blood2_3.title: Eye For an Eye
scene_blood2_3.description: You must always be vigilant in a place like this. Noticing that you remain indifferent to his words, the man sighs and laments how his play will end on a tragic note.

scene_bottle1_enter.title: Secret Entrance
scene_bottle1_enter.description: In your confusion, you smash through a wall to find a large, empty space hidden behind it. The room's furnishings highlight its user's unique artistic sensibilities. There are all kinds of antiques you have never seen plastered all over the wall. In the center of the room, an inscribed tablet brimming with historical richness, attracts your attention.

scene_bottle1_1.title: Secret Entrance
scene_bottle1_1.description: You take the tablet and find its backside inscribed with a sentence: 'The insults of the foolish and ignorant once left me sullen and stricken with grief, but art does not lose its meaning simply for rough appearances.'

scene_bottle1_2.title: Secret Entrance
scene_bottle1_2.description: The room's secret wall was well-designed. Its structure appears to be a peculiar combination of both Originium Arts and mechanical designs.

scene_bottle2_enter.title: Secret Chamber
scene_bottle2_enter.description: You trip over your exhausted feet and tumble down the castle's staircase, only to find a hidden trap door. It leads to a bedchamber with exquisite furnishings not seen anywhere else in the castle. The bedchamber is spotless as though it is cleaned on a regular basis. You notice there is a delicately carved sculpture on the work desk.

scene_bottle2_1.title: Secret Chamber
scene_bottle2_1.description: How does such an old castle have such an intricate hidden mechanism? Who is the master of this castle? Whatever the answer is, this room makes for a safe place for some rest, at the very least. Let's get some rest here.

scene_bottle2_2.title: Secret Chamber
scene_bottle2_2.description: The bottom of the sculpture is inscribed with a few sentences: 'Once, I was obsessed with radical artistic expression, but our small boat is still in search of the lake of beauty. None of this is for the fools with poor taste to criticize. If art was only about what is on the surface, then what even is the difference between beauty and ugliness?'

scene_bottle3_enter.title: Junkyard Bazaar
scene_bottle3_enter.description: In an open area of the castle, you see an unkempt Feline hawking goods. He notices you and enthusiastically promotes treasures that were 'collected from all around the castle through countless trials and tribulations.' However, you seem to think everything he is selling is useless junk.

scene_bottle3_1.title: Junkyard Bazaar
scene_bottle3_1.description: When he sees you take out the tablet, the slovenly Feline cries out in unparalleled excitement: 'This belonged to the troupe leader...' He quickly catches himself and throws a few Originium Ingots your way, and asks you not to tell anyone else you have this tablet. He then gives you his contact information and disappears down the hallway.

scene_bottle3_2.title: Junkyard Bazaar
scene_bottle3_2.description: It may all be junk, but that does not mean it is all useless.

scene_bottle3_3.title: Junkyard Bazaar
scene_bottle3_3.description: Who would do business with a shady guy like this?

scene_bottle4_enter.title: 'Art Connoisseur'
scene_bottle4_enter.description:
'You have several pieces of art on you that I believe belonged to a famous artist. Would you be so kind as to let me examine them?'
You meet a well-dressed, polite woman deep inside the castle. She seems to be interested in some of the artwork you have come across.

scene_bottle4_1.title: 'Art Connoisseur'
scene_bottle4_1.description: 'You are very kind. Please accept this book as a token of my appreciation.' The art connoisseur gives you an elegantly bound book.

scene_bottle4_2.title: 'Art Connoisseur'
scene_bottle4_2.description: 'Much appreciated,' the art connoisseur says and looks at you with a somewhat artificial-looking smile. She then leaves you with some supplies.

scene_bottle4_3.title: 'Art Connoisseur'
scene_bottle4_3.description: 'I appreciate your generosity,' the art connoisseur says and looks at you with a somewhat artificial-looking smile. She then leaves you with a large amount of cash.

scene_bottle4_4.title: 'Art Connoisseur'
scene_bottle4_4.description: 'That is unfortunate, then.' You notice the art connoisseur's rigid smile is hiding a hint of hostility.

scene_side1_enter.title: Reprieve?
scene_side1_enter.description: You reach a hall with an oil painting in a most conspicuous location. The painting depicts the ending of a tragic story. At the end of the story, the protagonist discovers that his entire life is a fabricated conspiracy. In his grief, he leaps off a tall tower as a last-ditch effort to break free of their control.

scene_side1_1.title: Reprieve?
scene_side1_1.description: You walk up to examine the oil painting. Suddenly, a puppet falls from above, shattering into pieces before you.

scene_side1_2.title: Reprieve?
scene_side1_2.description: This is so sad! Should bring it along.

scene_side1_3.title: Reprieve?
scene_side1_3.description: If reality was already so difficult, he could have at least made things easier on himself in the story.

scene_side2_enter.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_enter.description: A strange voice calls out from down the hallway. A swarm of puppets walking in a strange rhythm block your way. The puppets charge toward you, but it seems you are not their target. It is the broken puppet.

scene_side2_1.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_1.description: A puppet strikes your face. Ouch!

scene_side2_2.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_2.description: The puppets pull your ear and try to tie a small string around you... Ow!

scene_side2_3.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_3.description: You shield the broken puppet and charge forward, at last breaking free of the crazy puppets and making your way to the other end of the hallway. There is a youth scribbling something on a piece of paper with a quill. You are handed a pair of scissors.

scene_side2_4.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_4.description: Why a pair of scissors? There is no one around to answer the question, as the youth has already left.

scene_side2_5.title: Crazy Puppets
scene_side2_5.description: The puppets continue their advance. There is no way to break through, leaving you with no choice but to leave.

scene_side3_enter.title: Reprieve
scene_side3_enter.description: You walk up the stairs and notice a familiar figure standing next to the window. The figure suddenly turns around and thanks you, before squeezing a letter into your hand.

scene_side3_1.title: Reprieve
scene_side3_1.description: Before you receive an answer, the figure takes a step back and leaps out the window with a smile.

scene_hidden1_enter.title: Attending a Banquet
scene_hidden1_enter.description: A group of Leithanian nobles is hurriedly making its way to a party. One of them tells you that the organizer of the party is a spire caster obsessed with the performing arts, favoring grandiose functions and extravagance. The man has very high standards for all of his guests. The Leithanian noble takes a look at you and proposes the following after a brief moment of pondering: If you will attend the party, he is willing to transfer the invitation to you and provide an outfit as proper as his for free.

scene_hidden1_1.title: Attending a Banquet
scene_hidden1_1.description: The Leithanian noble breathes a sigh of relief. He tells you the party's organizer once studied certain forbidden Arts and has been putting on crazier and crazier events over the past few years. He is thankful that you are willing to attend in his stead.

scene_hidden1_2.title: Attending a Banquet
scene_hidden1_2.description: None of their ruckus concerns you. You opt to instead get some nice, decent sleep.

scene_hidden2_enter.title: A Gathering of Followers
scene_hidden2_enter.description: A heated conversation can be heard from inside the room. You listen carefully and make out bits and pieces through the thick Leithanian accent. 'He killed everyone at the party? Just for that play of his?' 'Didn't I say from the start we should never have let Ahrendts know about our plans. He's been out of his mind ever since he ran into that Crimson Troupe!' 'Don't say that, Andreas! At least he's actually done some research on Arts. Besides, I think those artists aren't so bad...' 'Hah, looks like you're pretty far gone yourself!'

scene_hidden2_1.title: A Gathering of Followers
scene_hidden2_1.description: There is no one inside the room, only a broken staff lying on the ground. It seems the argument you just heard was merely your imagination.

scene_hidden2_2.title: A Gathering of Followers
scene_hidden2_2.description: There seems to be quite a few people inside. It would be best to come back after you have made the necessary preparations.

scene_writer1_enter.title: Don't disturb them
scene_writer1_enter.description: You barge into a dungeon. The prisoners within are silent, showing no reaction to your sudden entry. You see some of them carving on the walls, while others curl up on the ground, muttering to themselves.

scene_writer1_1.title: Don't disturb them
scene_writer1_1.description: 'Why do you disturb me? Why do you not let me finish my story?!' One of the prisoners suddenly stands up and rams the cell door.

scene_writer1_2.title: Don't disturb them
scene_writer1_2.description: You leave the dungeon. As you walk away, you hear the sound of exultant laughter coming from behind.

scene_writer2_enter.title: Revenge Story
scene_writer2_enter.description: In the dimly-lit room, you see a young man sat by himself before a desk, dipping his quill into a bottle of strangely-colored ink and writing intently in the flickering candlelight. He does not notice your approach.

scene_writer2_1.title: Revenge Story
scene_writer2_1.description: You approach the young man. His quill suddenly begins to burn, and he disappears in the rising flames and smoke. You find yourself surrounded by a bunch of lunatics.

scene_writer2_2.title: Revenge Story
scene_writer2_2.description: The young man stops, places his quill into the inkwell, and leaves.

BATTLE_NORMAL.name: Combat Ops.
BATTLE_NORMAL.description: Everyone has their weapons drawn. They're definitely not here to negotiate.

BATTLE_ELITE.name: Emergency Ops.
BATTLE_ELITE.description: Some violence may well exceed your expectations, a very common occurrence.

BATTLE_BOSS.name: Dreadful Foe
BATTLE_BOSS.description: Criminals, ruffians, and the damned… You're in trouble.

SHOP.name: Rogue Trader
SHOP.description: Not an ally, or an enemy. Some people like to sit on the fence.

REST.name: Safe House
REST.description: Quiet, comfortable, and secluded from the castle's trifling matters. It's time to take a break.

INCIDENT.name: Encounter
INCIDENT.description: New friends, old rivals… Strange encounters never age. Only scars stand the test of time.

TREASURE.name: Boons
TREASURE.description: A little bit of help for your journey.

ENTERTAINMENT.name: Downtime Recreation
ENTERTAINMENT.description: Give away all your resources in the name of art.

UNKNOWN.name: Dense Fog
UNKNOWN.description: There's something in the mist, but you cannot see anything...

variation_1.functionDesc: The map for this floor has been expanded.
variation_1.desc: The road branches into multiple directions. You feel you are unable to pick the right path.

variation_2.functionDesc: On this floor, node types will become unidentifiable after your next action.
variation_2.desc: Even though everything is right before your eyes, you feel it is all a haze.

variation_3.functionDesc: On this floor, Combat Ops. will appear more frequently.
variation_3.desc: They are all enemies, and you thirst to rip and tear your enemies apart!

variation_4.functionDesc: On this floor, the amount of Hope required for Recruitment is increased; the amount of Hope required for Promotion is decreased.
variation_4.desc: You are afraid of losing all that you hold dear. You will do everything it takes to make sure they do not go anywhere.

variation_5.functionDesc: On this floor, each action will grant additional Originium Ingot. The Originium Ingot acquired on this floor cannot be brought away when leaving.
variation_5.desc: Your extra riches make you ecstatic, but your fear of losing them keeps you just as restless.

variation_6.functionDesc: On this floor, the amount of Life Points lost and gained are greatly increased.
variation_6.desc: Whether joy or sorrow, everything you feel is intensified.

variation_7.functionDesc: On this floor, enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP.
variation_7.desc: In your imagination, your enemies grow taller and taller.

variation_8.functionDesc: On this floor, friendly units and non-Boss enemy units will take constant damage but receive increased ATK and ASPD.
variation_8.desc: Life slips away. Survival instinct is rousing your potential.

variation_9.functionDesc: On this floor, Deployment Limit is reduced, but Squad Size Limit is increased.
variation_9.desc: You invited many to come on this journey with you, but you are very cautious during deployment.

MAIN: Good morning, good afternoon, and good night.
You give me the Originium, and I give you the goods. Don't worry too much about the details.
We are old friends, but business is business.
Why am I helping you? Think of it as an investment.
Rhodes Island is a business, and I am a businessman. See, we're of a kind.
This isn't scavenging, I just took a treasure that nobody else wanted.
You want to hear a story? Sure, my friend, but good tales don't come cheap.
We meet again, friend. What are you buying this time?
Long time no see, my dear old friend. I'm glad you're still alive and kicking.
I never expected to run into you here in this castle. Do you seek treasures? Or perhaps a person?
Be careful of everyone you meet here. Some of them are in the Troupe.
RECRUIT_TICKET: You need manpower? I got you. No need to hesitate.
Be careful of any Columbian organizations with 'Maylander' in the name.
This is way cheaper than having your boss look all around for a Messenger.
You guys at Rhodes Island have all sorts of weirdos, huh...
I know, everyone has their own affairs to attend to.
You need some help, but that help's not going to be free.
Can I have a look-see at Rhodes Island's aircraft? No? Too bad.
If you want to find a fighter, Sarkaz and Blacksteel are good options.
Life in the barrens is full of pain. It's not easy to survive.
Look at the poor bastards swallowed whole by their obsessions in this castle. I hope you won't end up like that.
'Shrouded by the shadows of his own past, the bewildered Feline searches in vain through the castle for his nemeses.'
RELIC: Don't worry. Spending money keeps world moving.
Don't be too high-maintenance, picking up all these scraps was very hard work.
An armed society is a polite society.
What good is this thing for? Why, you just need to buy it to find out!
They say Laterano is a place without conflict and hatred. Do you buy that? I don't.
Gaul is long gone, but its remnants are still driving many to run the gauntlet.
Once I bought a whole crate of Honey Biscuits, but a Perro girl made off with all of them.
You want to travel to the depths of the Sami tundra? Even the Empire of Ursus stays away from that place.
For every ten Siracusans you run into, about five of them are part of a 'Family.' Be careful.
Crimson Troupe? They're a bunch of mad artists, and a bunch of cruel criminals.
You've got a friend who's part of the Crimson Troupe? Time to get new friends.
ACTIVE_TOOL: Better safe than sorry. You want to be prepared for anything that comes your way, friend.
This little thing is equal parts worthless and terrifying...
What's this thing for? Good question, I don't know either.
BANK_ENTRY: Come take a look at this new toy. The Prospective Investment System. Use your extra riches to pave the way for the future.
Farsightedness is a good thing to have. You can buy unlimited possibilities with money. It's a good thing, my friend.
This is the kind of stuff Columbian entrepreneurs love to peddle! Capitalism, ho!
BANK_INVEST: You're an optimistic one. Try your hand at investing in the future, then! You won't regret it, friend.
Don't let the spending get to you. You don't need the cash now, and this will come in handy later.
BANK_WITHDRAWAL: Just the time to thank the great foresight of your past self, am I right, friend?
Investment buys you wealth. Fine, it's not that simple, but it's what everyone likes.
Your small investments here and there eventually help you overcome all difficulties. It's a good thing.
Take your time, friend. You still have to prepare for your next adventure, no?
BANK_FAULTY: Oh, looks like there's a little problem with our investment return system...
Looks like our investment system's got a few bugs... Maybe come back next time?
Looks like our investment system's running into trouble again. Mr. D's equipment's not as stable as he says, eh?
BANK_REWARD_UNLOCK: Your investment reserves have gone up, friend. It's a good thing.
With your investment reserves, you can set out on your adventures with confidence.
Wonderful! Your next adventure will go much more smoothly. Probably.
Ah, I can see right away you are a cautious one. Maybe a little too cautious.
OUTER_NORMAL: I will take only a small commission for your future adventure investments. It's a fair deal.
There's a saying in Yan: 'Plan ahead, or plan to fail.' The Yanese have a point.
I got myself some new trinkets. You'll love them.
You should invest in your upcoming adventures!
OUTER_REWARD: Thank you for your support, friend. Let's keep working together.

ro_ending_1.name: Crimson Finale
ro_ending_1.desc: The curtain falls, and the actors all step off the stage. You have found those who you were looking for, and your exploration of the castle has come to an end. Perhaps it is time to return to a normal life.

ro_ending_2.name: Ridiculous Comedy
ro_ending_2.desc: The curtain falls, and the actors all step off the stage. You have found those who you were looking for, but no one can say for sure that your exploration of the castle has come to an end. Perhaps this is only the beginning...
ro_ending_2.changeEndingDesc: In a trance, you see a large Ursus doll. Bound by layers of chains, the doll is crying.

ro_ending_3.name: Grand Opening
ro_ending_3.desc: The host raises the curtain! He bows to the audience alongside his actors as all kinds of tragedies and comedies begin to unfold. He is the one who sets the stage, and he is the one who brings the show to an end. Be sure to offer him flowers when the show is over.
ro_ending_3.changeEndingDesc: You find that the troupe member from Leithanien is behind everything happening in the castle.

ro_ending_4.name: Silent Chapter
ro_ending_4.desc: Every word written by the Playwright is true. The truth is blood, is tears, is life, is death, but the truth of the Crimson Troupe goes even deeper. Seek it, discover it, and escape it.
ro_ending_4.changeEndingDesc: 'Ye who has ink shall write with the Playwright a story of the many.'

battleLoadingTips.tip: The Crimson Troupe—A perennial, mysterious theatrical company, a band of artists that offers brilliant performances wheresoever they travel. It seems tragic happenings often follow in the wake of their tragedy performances.
The Troupe Leader—The elusive mastermind of the Crimson Troupe. Preferring to stay in the shadows, it is said that his title and many variants of it have existed for hundreds of years.

The Calais-Blason Region—A remote territory on the edge of Gaul. It has been part of Victoria since the fall of Gaul. The War of the Four Nations left the region completely devastated, reducing its population and productivity to a minimum.

The Castle—A castle hidden within the woods constructed under the auspices of a Gaulish noble who perished in the war a few years after its completion, leaving it derelict. But a mysterious group has been calling it home recently...
During your initial recruitment, you can recruit your friends' Operators via Support Recruitment
Operators recruited via 'Temporary Recruitment' will not consume Hope. Do not miss the opportunity
'Hope' can be used to Recruit or Promote Operators
Combining different collectibles can lead to unexpected results
Training more Operators and developing the possibilities between them can grant you a greater advantage during combat
The abilities of the first Operators you recruit are equivalent to Elite 1
You can consume 'Inspiration' to permanently increase your abilities in Regular Operations

rogue_1_band_1.usage: Gain 4 Temporary Life Points at the beginning of each battle.

rogue_1_band_3.name: Support Squad
rogue_1_band_3.usage: Start with +20 Originium Ingots and +2 Hope.
rogue_1_band_3.unlockCondDesc: Across all adventures, earn a total of 200 Originium Ingots

rogue_1_band_4.name: Spearhead Squad
rogue_1_band_4.usage: Start with 1 Life Point; All Operators gain +15% ATK and +15% Max HP
rogue_1_band_4.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure with at least 10 Life Points remaining.

rogue_1_band_5.name: Tactical Assault Squad
rogue_1_band_5.usage: When recruiting a 4-star or above Vanguard or Guard Operator, that Operator is automatically Promoted.
rogue_1_band_5.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure while having at least 5 Vanguard or Guard Operators.

rogue_1_band_6.name: Tactical Fortification Squad
rogue_1_band_6.usage: When recruiting a 4-star or above Defender or Supporter Operator, that Operator is automatically Promoted.
rogue_1_band_6.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure while having at least 5 Defender or Supporter Operators.

rogue_1_band_7.name: Tactical Ranged Squad
rogue_1_band_7.usage: When recruiting a 4-star or above Medic or Sniper Operator, that Operator is automatically Promoted.
rogue_1_band_7.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure while having at least 5 Medic or Sniper Operators.

rogue_1_band_8.name: Tactical Destruction Squad
rogue_1_band_8.usage: When recruiting a 4-star or above Caster or Specialist Operator, that Operator is automatically Promoted.
rogue_1_band_8.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure while having at least 5 Specialist or Caster Operators.

rogue_1_band_9.name: Research Squad
rogue_1_band_9.usage: Start with +2 Life Points; Gain +30% Command EXP from battles
rogue_1_band_9.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, earn a total of 1000 Command EXP

rogue_1_band_10.name: First-Class Squad
rogue_1_band_10.usage: When Recruiting for the first time, gain a random Elite Recruitment Voucher
rogue_1_band_10.unlockCondDesc: Complete an adventure while having at least 20 Operators

rogue_1_relic_a01.name: 'Silent Squad'
rogue_1_relic_a01.description: A set of exploration drones remotely controlled by the Rhodes Island Engineering Department. More efficient and safer than ever, they provide operators on field missions the omnidirectional support and defense they need.
rogue_1_relic_a01.usage: All friendly units have +35% ATK, +35% DEF, and +45% Max HP

rogue_1_relic_a02.name: Fissured Restraints
rogue_1_relic_a02.description: It seems this sturdy band was once used to restrain something terrifying... Help...

rogue_1_relic_a03.name: Abyssal Wyrdmask
rogue_1_relic_a03.description: An eldritch mask not belonging to any culture you're familiar with that is capable of making people lose their will to fight... and unconsciously fall into a state of deep contemplation.
rogue_1_relic_a03.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Leader Squad' and complete your adventure.

rogue_1_relic_a04.name: Godmother's Token
rogue_1_relic_a04.description: A laurel of bones, the token of a Sicilian noblewoman. This symbol of order will smooth the turbulance of all desires, for conflict is not allowed. Genuine or counterfeit, it still demands you to kneel.

rogue_1_relic_a05.name: Worn-out Group Photo
rogue_1_relic_a05.description: Do you know someone in the photo?

rogue_1_relic_a06.name: Writer's Tongue
rogue_1_relic_a06.description: The playwright penned his creations with a quill and his own blood, and for himself he devised an ending in which he perishes in a sea of flames.
rogue_1_relic_a06.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Gathering Squad' and complete your adventure.

rogue_1_relic_a08.name: Gold-Plated Die
rogue_1_relic_a08.description: The gold-plated die has one side representing life. As for the other nineteen sides...
rogue_1_relic_a08.unlockCondDesc: Select 'First-Class Squad' and complete your adventure

rogue_1_relic_a09.name: 'The Whisperer in Darknight'
rogue_1_relic_a09.description: A black vinyl. DO. NOT. TOUCH. IT.

rogue_1_relic_a10.name: ‘Profound Silence'
rogue_1_relic_a10.description: A painting that depicts the greatest disaster in Iberian history. Its brushstrokes, colors, and images are all meaningless. 'The Ægir know. The Ægir know. The Ægir know.'

rogue_1_relic_a11.name: Oriron Round Shield
rogue_1_relic_a11.description: Before the use of Oriron became widespread in today's industrial sector, the material was frequently used to forge military weapons like this one.

rogue_1_relic_a12.name: Military Mirror Armor
rogue_1_relic_a12.description: This mirror armor used to be able to withstand most attacks on the chest, but with the fall of Gaul, such archaic forms of armor have become museum pieces.
rogue_1_relic_a12.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Spearhead Squad' and complete your adventure.

rogue_1_relic_a13.name: Old Steam Armor
rogue_1_relic_a13.description: Even this old, outdated steam armor seems to carry with it the resplendence of when the Victorian monarchs cast their glory across half the world.

rogue_1_relic_a14.name: Emperor's Favor
rogue_1_relic_a14.description: A very sharp letter opener. It was one of the favorite possessions of the last Ursus emperor, and as such it was very rarely used to actually open letters.
rogue_1_relic_a14.usage: All friendly melee units have +15% ATK.

rogue_1_relic_a15.name: Royal Rapier
rogue_1_relic_a15.description: A highly decorative rapier for nobles. Used by Gaulish nobles first and foremost, though perhaps a little fragile for a military weapon.
rogue_1_relic_a15.usage: All friendly melee units have +25% ATK.
rogue_1_relic_a15.unlockCondDesc: Clear the 3rd Floor, 'Homeland Remnants,' when you have exactly 0 Originium Ingots

rogue_1_relic_a16.name: Vieux Vanguard's Blade
rogue_1_relic_a16.description: Prior to its downfall, Gaul first witnessed the sacrifices of its Vieux Vanguards.
rogue_1_relic_a16.usage: All friendly melee units have +35% ATK.

rogue_1_relic_a17.name: Necklace of the Presence
rogue_1_relic_a17.description: Faith hangs ten centimeters above your heart, spoken words flow into your blood, and bullets slide into your magazine.
rogue_1_relic_a17.usage: All friendly ranged units have +15% ATK.

rogue_1_relic_a18.name: Silver Forks
rogue_1_relic_a18.description: One for dealing with actors who botch their performances, one for dealing with incompetent playwrights, and one for anyone who needs it. The Chief will not tolerate any mistakes on the table.
rogue_1_relic_a18.usage: All friendly ranged units have +25% ATK.
rogue_1_relic_a18.unlockCondDesc: Clear the battle, 'Knights' Duel,' without losing any Life Point

rogue_1_relic_a19.name: Damaged Revolver Cylinder
rogue_1_relic_a19.description: She never capitulated, even after enduring countless trials and tribulations. Her muzzle belched tongues of flame that burned like an angry sun, and the glow above her head was brighter than the daylight itself. Buried here is Outcast, our friend.
rogue_1_relic_a19.usage: All friendly ranged units have +35% ATK.

rogue_1_relic_a20.name: Noxious Hemostatic Agent
rogue_1_relic_a20.description: 'After fermentation, the body fluids of this Originium slug can be used to stop bleeding.' —'Rhodes Island Wilderness Survival Guide'

rogue_1_relic_a21.name: First Aid Kit
rogue_1_relic_a21.description: '...Please use antibiotics and ethanol additives under the supervision of professionals...' —Rim Billiton Production Safety Manual
rogue_1_relic_a21.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Tactical Assault Squad' and complete your adventure.

rogue_1_relic_a22.name: Unknown Instrument
rogue_1_relic_a22.description: Don't ask. It's for your own good.

rogue_1_relic_a23.name: Rusted Razor
rogue_1_relic_a23.description: If you cut yourself with this, you know what will happen.

rogue_1_relic_a24.name: Carriage Driver's Whip
rogue_1_relic_a24.description: As the troupe's carriage driver, he has no name and no past. His life is meaningful only when he whips his burdenbeasts.
rogue_1_relic_a24.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Tactical Fortification Squad' and complete your adventure.

rogue_1_relic_a25.name: 'Avenger'
rogue_1_relic_a25.description: A gift from Theresis and set up by Theresa, this is the very first weapon that Ascalon received after her inaugural mission as part of the Military Council.

rogue_1_relic_a26.name: Standard Anti-Riot Instrument
rogue_1_relic_a26.description: Standard equipment of the Ursus Guard. Comes with an intermittent blinding Originium Arts effect. Unfortunately, not many Guards out there remember this when push comes to shove.

rogue_1_relic_a27.name: Emperor's Collection
rogue_1_relic_a27.description: The Sami revere their wild lands more than anything, and this fragment of the vast wilderness sleeps in the personal collection of the Emperor of Ursus.
rogue_1_relic_a27.unlockCondDesc: Select 'Research Squad' and complete your adventure

rogue_1_relic_a28.name: 'Brilliant Lament'
rogue_1_relic_a28.description: His blood yet flows. He has never left this place.

rogue_1_relic_a29.name: Live Rose
rogue_1_relic_a29.description: Is it you who nourish her, or is it her who protects you?
rogue_1_relic_a29.usage: All friendly units have +20% healing effectiveness

rogue_1_relic_a30.name: White Flower Crown
rogue_1_relic_a30.description: A floral veil used in Vampire rituals. Its once vibrant redness has been sucked empty, leaving nothing only a pale white color.
rogue_1_relic_a30.usage: All friendly units have +30% healing effectiveness
rogue_1_relic_a30.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, recover at least 500000 HP

rogue_1_relic_a31.name: Actor's Perfume
rogue_1_relic_a31.description: Troupe actors put this on before going onstage. Stable yet aromatic fragrances like this can help them ease pressure. That's how it seems on the surface, at least.
rogue_1_relic_a31.usage: All friendly units recover 1% of Max HP per second
rogue_1_relic_a31.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, recover at least 250000 HP

rogue_1_relic_a32.name: Designer's Ruler
rogue_1_relic_a32.description: Carefully measured with data and experience, those who wear this armor are known to be several magnitudes luckier.
rogue_1_relic_a32.usage: All friendly units have +15% Physical Dodge

rogue_1_relic_a33.name: 'Arts Killer'
rogue_1_relic_a33.description: Considering how Originium Arts and music go hand in hand in Leithanien, it's quite amazing someone came up with the bright idea of combating Arts with noise like this.
rogue_1_relic_a33.usage: All friendly units have +15% Arts Dodge

rogue_1_relic_a34.name: Dancer's Bracelets
rogue_1_relic_a34.description: The audience breaks into applause as the well-trained dancers waltz around the traps on stage. None of them are aware of the brushes with death the performers have just been through.
rogue_1_relic_a34.usage: All friendly units have +10% Physical and Arts Dodge

rogue_1_relic_a35.name: Ursus Big Bread
rogue_1_relic_a35.description: Food from Ursus with a strong, fermented taste. Quite sour.

rogue_1_relic_a36.name: Crucible Cream Puff
rogue_1_relic_a36.description: Those who walk treacherous paths feast on this dessert to soothe their souls.

rogue_1_relic_a37.name: Iron Baguette
rogue_1_relic_a37.description: A hard, rod-shaped bread. Always keep one on you. Not only does it fill you up, you can use it as a weapon to defend yourself.
rogue_1_relic_a37.unlockCondDesc: In a single 'A Tiny Stage' event, insert coins at least 10 times

rogue_1_relic_a38.name: Test Run Chocolate
rogue_1_relic_a38.description: Just a test product a researcher threw together by tossing together their personal favorites, salted egg yolks and chocolate. Not yet suitable for the mass market. 'Still don't have that crispiness to them...'
rogue_1_relic_a38.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, recruit a total of 70 Operators

rogue_1_relic_a39.name: Gaulish Macarons
rogue_1_relic_a39.description: With how much sugar there is in Gaulish macarons, some bakeries concocted these miniature treats for their customers' guilt-free enjoyment.

rogue_1_relic_a40.name: Victorian Cake
rogue_1_relic_a40.unlockCondDesc: Reach a Squad Size Limit of 13 at any point.

rogue_1_relic_a41.name: Route Diagram
rogue_1_relic_a41.description: A hand-drawn map sketched out by an operator. Comes with explanations on the route, too. No one except its creator can decipher the map.

rogue_1_relic_a42.name: Dim Lantern
rogue_1_relic_a42.description:
A lantern used during explorations. Operators can either hold it or hang it from their bags.
It's very bright outside, but it's hardly usable in here.

rogue_1_relic_a43.name: Brass Compass
rogue_1_relic_a43.description: It's always pointing at the same direction, but where is it pointing exactly?

rogue_1_relic_a44.name: Broke Mask
rogue_1_relic_a44.description:
He's wearing the mask.
Is he the one who's speaking or is it the mask?

rogue_1_relic_a45.name: Blank Business Card
rogue_1_relic_a45.description: A mysterious card with the mysterious assassin's contact information written in most mysterious ways.
rogue_1_relic_a45.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, recruit a total of 120 Operators

rogue_1_relic_a46.name: Doll House
rogue_1_relic_a46.description: All kids need at least one set.

rogue_1_relic_a47.name: Miniature Stage Model
rogue_1_relic_a47.description: The red paint has not dried yet. Careful. Don't get that paint on your hand.

rogue_1_relic_a48.name: Dreambind Castle Model
rogue_1_relic_a48.description: You've seen this place, and you once wandered the castle, yet you now hold it in your hand. Is this real, or is it all a dream?

rogue_1_relic_c01.name: Ursus Chachek
rogue_1_relic_c01.description: The currents of steel and iron gush forth on the barren plains. From afar surge an inviolable, absolute will. Wheresoever my hands reach, there stands Ursus.
rogue_1_relic_c01.usage: All enemy units have +40% ATK, DEF, and Max HP

rogue_1_relic_c02.name: Victoria Crown
rogue_1_relic_c02.description: When the last Aslan to rule Victoria was sent to the guillotine, the angry masses rushed forward to trample his reign into dust.
rogue_1_relic_c02.usage: All enemy units have +30% ATK, DEF, and Max HP; Boss units gain an additional +15% ATK, +15% DEF, and +30% Max HP

rogue_1_relic_c03.name: Leithanien Sceptre
rogue_1_relic_c03.description: It was not long ago that the Witch King's scepter flowed with daylight and the night sky.
rogue_1_relic_c03.usage: All enemy units have +30% ATK, DEF, and Max HP; Entering a new node decreases Life Point by 1 (cannot be reduced beneath 1 this way)

rogue_1_relic_c04.name: Gaul Mantle
rogue_1_relic_c04.description: An artifact left behind by the late Gaulish emperor. A symbol of power and glory.
rogue_1_relic_c04.usage: All enemy units have +25% ATK, DEF, and Max HP; 4-star and above Operators cost +1 Hope when recruited

rogue_1_relic_c05.name: Half-Refined Diamond
rogue_1_relic_c05.description: Half of it shines radiantly in the name of art, while the other half is stained in a madder red color that signifies madness. This is the 'Phantom' that the troupe leader has always dreamt of.
rogue_1_relic_c05.usage: All enemy units have +25% ATK, DEF, and Max HP; Gain -50% Command EXP from battles

rogue_1_relic_c06.name: Sigil of Tragodia
rogue_1_relic_c06.description: A symbol that can be seen everywhere within the Crimson Troupe. It burns the troupe leader and his pursuit for the arts into the eyes of all those who lay their eyes upon it.
rogue_1_relic_c06.usage: All enemy units have +30% ATK, DEF, and Max HP; Deployment Limit -2

rogue_1_relic_m01.name: 'Right Eye of the Natator'
rogue_1_relic_m01.description: One half of the Gaulish empress's crown is now housed in the Royal Museum of Londinium. When she learned of the death of the emperor, the empress consort was determined to fight her enemies to the end—for her country, and for her departed beloved.
rogue_1_relic_m01.usage: Guard and Sniper Operators have +15% ATK, but Supporter and Caster Operators have -5% ATK

rogue_1_relic_m02.name: 'Left Eye of the Natator'
rogue_1_relic_m02.description: One half of the Gaulish empress's crown is now stored housed in the Leithanian Queen Library. The empress dismissed all her attendants, granted clemency to all criminals, and sat solemnly alone on the throne that was once her husband's, awaiting the invaders—She was determined to die not by at hands of her enemies, but under the effects of Originium crystals.
rogue_1_relic_m02.usage: Supporter and Caster Operators have +15% ATK, but Guard and Sniper Operators have -5% ATK

rogue_1_relic_m03.name: 'Magnificent Visage'
rogue_1_relic_m03.description: It's a good thing that a glimpse of her face feels you with hope—and especially so if you knew of the disaster.
rogue_1_relic_m03.usage: Gain +1 Hope upon entering a noncombat node.

rogue_1_relic_m04.name: 'Blademace'
rogue_1_relic_m04.description: A sword lodged in a stone. Was someone bored enough to do this?
rogue_1_relic_m04.usage: All Operators have +5 DP Cost, but gain +10% ATK, DEF, and Max HP

rogue_1_relic_m05.name: 'Brokenblade'
rogue_1_relic_m05.description: A broken sword. It's usable... probably...
rogue_1_relic_m05.usage: All Operators have -30% Max HP, but have -50% Redeployment Time

rogue_1_relic_m06.name: Familiar Sculpture
rogue_1_relic_m06.description: A familiar face but a different vibe. Perhaps you have met this person?

rogue_1_relic_m07.name: Proof of Friendship
rogue_1_relic_m07.description: Some old Vampire families are still concerned with formalities and etiquette. When they extend to others their exalted friendship, they do not allow it to be sullied.

rogue_1_relic_m08.name: Jet-Black Dance Shoes
rogue_1_relic_m08.description: The Columbian dancer's steps are firm and strong, her taps reverberating loudly in the air as she strikes the ground.
rogue_1_relic_m08.usage: Can deploy Melee Operators on High Ground tiles
rogue_1_relic_m08.unlockCondDesc: Clear the 3rd Floor, 'Homeland Remnants' 3 times, when you have recruited 6 or more Ranged or Melee Operators

rogue_1_relic_m09.name: Pure White Dance Shoes
rogue_1_relic_m09.description: The Ursus dancer's steps are swift and elegant, her body moving as she wills.
rogue_1_relic_m09.usage: Can deploy Ranged Operators on Low Ground tiles
rogue_1_relic_m09.unlockCondDesc: Clear the 3rd Floor, 'Homeland Remnants' 3 times, when you have recruited 6 or more Ranged or Melee Operators

rogue_1_relic_m10.name: 'Bladedance'
rogue_1_relic_m10.description: An artifact left behind by a 'Crimson Troupe' member. 'Bladedance' was a quiet Sargon dancer as well as a warrior of spectacular martial prowess, and her loyalty to the troupe is unparalleled. Even among the members of the troupe, there are few people who know of her dark past.
rogue_1_relic_m10.usage: When the battle begins, a random Operator will have +100% ATK and +100% Max HP within the operation

rogue_1_relic_m11.name: ‘Whiteflower'
rogue_1_relic_m11.description: An artifact left behind by a 'Crimson Troupe' member. The stage name 'White Solanum' belonged to a famous Leithanian opera actress. Supposedly, the actress revered as the 'Whiteflower that stands atop the high tower' had complex relationships with many of the tower's nobles, and she even tried to spark a few scuffles among them.
rogue_1_relic_m11.usage: When the battle begins, randomize all allied operators' Deployment Cost

rogue_1_relic_m12.name: 'Shadow'
rogue_1_relic_m12.description: An artifact left behind by a 'Crimson Troupe' member. The rumor has it that, before he joined the troupe, the 'Shadow' was a Siracusan stage caster famous for his superb illusionary techniques. It is also said that he killed many members of the family during his performances with his Originium Arts.
rogue_1_relic_m12.usage: Increase the probability of Temporary Recruitment when using Recruitment Voucher

rogue_1_relic_m13.name: 'Flowers of Quinde'
rogue_1_relic_m13.description: An epic narrative poem etched on a stone tablet. It was written eight hundred years ago by a famous Gaulish poet, but although modern literary scholars hold the poem in extremely high regard, historical records show that he was often ridiculed by his contemporaries for his obese figure and unattractive facial features.
rogue_1_relic_m13.usage: All friendly units recover 10 HP every second

rogue_1_relic_m14.name: 'Numbness and Obscenity'
rogue_1_relic_m14.description: A famous art piece and the final piece created by an insane Leithanian sculptor two hundred years ago. The sculptor was known for his extraordinary talent and his participation in multiple cruel homicides. However, historical records show that few people took notice of his work. He was instead known for his features and beauty.

rogue_1_relic_m15.name: 'Beauty and Ugliness in the Age of Terra'
rogue_1_relic_m15.description: A legendary book published in Victoria fifteen years ago. The book describes the author's appreciation of aesthetics in simple terms, and it contains a comprehensive record of literary, artistic and musical knowledge and history. The book covers both the past and present and is an easy read, with many honoring it as the 'great art encyclopedia of our generation.' Yet it is rumored that the book's author was the leader of a certain small troupe and was murdered a few years ago by a hitman codenamed 'Blood Diamond.'
rogue_1_relic_m15.usage: For one time only during any battle prior to the final battle of the area, gain 10 Life Points and continue onto the next step instead of concluding the exploration upon mission failure
rogue_1_relic_m15.unlockCondDesc: In a single battle, lose a total of 20 Life Points (including mission failures)

rogue_1_relic_m16.name: Worn-out Puppet
rogue_1_relic_m16.description: 'He said he has had enough. He will be a puppet no longer.'
rogue_1_relic_m16.usage: The adventure will head towards a different ending

rogue_1_relic_m17.name: Useless Scissors
rogue_1_relic_m17.description: This pair of scissors has been used for far, far too long. So long that it can no longer cut anything tangible, and so long that it can cut all things intangible to shreds.
rogue_1_relic_m17.usage: Immediately adds +11 Originium Ingots and +3 Hope

rogue_1_relic_m18.name: Blank Suicide Note
rogue_1_relic_m18.description: His only wish was to escape the madman who wanted control over him. Now, he got his wish.
rogue_1_relic_m18.usage: Neutralizes Big Sad Lock's Self-Healing abilities

rogue_1_relic_m19.name: Mantle of the Wrongly Condemned
rogue_1_relic_m19.description: The crazed Caster of the tower organized a special banquet. All the guests who were present at the reception hall out of courtesy became witnesses when the curtain rose.
rogue_1_relic_m19.usage: All friendly units have +2 DP Cost.

rogue_1_relic_m20.name: Stand-in Actor
rogue_1_relic_m20.description: The playwright never approved of his inauguration of these shows. No matter, though. The master of ceremonies is not discouraged. He has as many understudies at his disposal.
rogue_1_relic_m20.usage: All friendly units have +3% ATK, DEF, and Max HP

rogue_1_relic_m21.name: Abrupt Realization
rogue_1_relic_m21.description: The Witch King's followers have given everything for the arts. Their flesh, their blood, their beliefs, and their souls.
rogue_1_relic_m21.usage: All friendly units have -3 DP Cost and gain +5% ATK, DEF, and Max HP. The adventure will head towards a different ending

rogue_1_relic_p01.name: Blunt Claws - Advancement
rogue_1_relic_p01.description: Plant a great stone within the waters. Split the waves and part the fog.
rogue_1_relic_p01.usage: Vanguard Operators have -2 DP Cost and +60% Max HP

rogue_1_relic_p02.name: Blunt Claws - Burst
rogue_1_relic_p02.description: He's already done all the reserve squad's work for them. What else do you expect?
rogue_1_relic_p02.unlockCondDesc: Across multiple adventures, defeat Boss 'The Forsaken' once

rogue_1_relic_p03.name: Blunt Claws - Proficiency
rogue_1_relic_p03.description: As an operator who often enters the battlefield before anyone else, you cannot fathom what they have been through.
