detailConst.defaultSacrificeDesc: The lighthouse has fallen. People open their bags, delivering light for each other.
detailConst.defaultExpeditionSelectDesc: Operator {0} will return with supplies after this floor is complete.

ro2_n_1_1.name: Cistern
ro2_n_1_1.description:
The scramble for fresh water highlights what once was a matter of trust. When water is no longer safe to drink, panic rips through the masses. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Deep Water Zones> that cause enemies inside to have reduced Movement Speed and continuously lose HP.</>

ro2_n_1_2.name: Insect Infestation
ro2_n_1_2.description: Apparently, insect swarms are better at detecting danger than humans, so what are these bugs trying to avoid?

ro2_n_1_3.name: Sniper Squad
ro2_n_1_3.description: Some archers have banded together to hunt along the coast. All living things are their prey.

ro2_n_1_4.name: Symbiosis
ro2_n_1_4.description: As long as it is conducive to the survival of the collective, we many sometimes allow non-Seaborn to coexist with the colony, even providing aid when necessary.

ro2_n_2_1.name: Voiceless Summons
ro2_n_2_1.description:
What is it that allows some humans to utilize Sea Terrors? Or, is this utilization nothing more than wishful thinking on the part of the humans? 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Bushes> that prevent your units inside from being targeted by enemy ranged attacks.</>

ro2_n_2_2.name: Leviathan's Followers
ro2_n_2_2.description:
Some Church of the Deep cultists have heard of a Leviathan that floats on the surface of the ocean like an iceberg, so naturally they worship it as an avatar of ice and snow. But naturally, they have no idea what 'ice and snow' truly are, considering they've never seen it before. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Originium Ice Crystals> that periodically apply the Cold status in an area around them.</>

ro2_n_2_3.name: Malady
ro2_n_2_3.description:
The land's malady cannot infect the ocean, but the islands above the water's surface are still its playthings. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Originium Altars> that periodically damage friendly and enemy units around them.</>

ro2_n_2_4.name: Omen
ro2_n_2_4.description: The Church of the Deep cultists have brought a Sea Terror following its reproductive instincts ashore. If not dealt with promptly, there will be a small tide of Sea Terrors in the surrounding area within a few days.

ro2_n_2_5.name: Ebb
ro2_n_2_5.description: Some Sea Terrors have behaviors that match the regularity of the tide's ebb and flow. Observant Hunters use this as an opportunity to go forth and eliminate them.

ro2_n_3_1.name: Crime and Punishment
ro2_n_3_1.description: These rogues were unable to extract any wealth from the Sea Terrors, so they turned their blades on their fellow men. This time, they struck a sheet of metal.

ro2_n_3_2.name: Troglodyte Tribe
ro2_n_3_2.description:
They are crueler, more intractable, and more belligerent than their Sargonian kin. So save your breath and pick up your weapons. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Active Originium> that greatly increases the ATK and ASPD of units that pass over it, but makes them lose HP over time.</>

ro2_n_3_3.name: Craft Brewer Killer
ro2_n_3_3.description: Faced with a past-due shipment, a broken-down car, and now a swarm of Sea Terrors drunk off his slated-for-delivery craft brews, his insanity seems rather justifiable.

ro2_n_3_4.name: Sanguinarch's Legacy
ro2_n_3_4.description: There may not be much of a difference between blood and seawater, at least in form. Therefore, anywhere the azure waves still ripple, the Sanguinarch's offspring can still survive.

ro2_n_3_5.name: Precarious Defense
ro2_n_3_5.description: With the proper tactical decisions and everyone's mutual support, there may yet be a way to survive this savagery and madness.

ro2_n_3_6.name: The Nest
ro2_n_3_6.description: The Sea Terror's nest extends in all directions, and intruders quickly find themselves trapped from two sides. By the time they manage to kill one that volunteered itself to stay behind as distraction, its kin have long since relocated.

ro2_n_3_7.name: Vortex
ro2_n_3_7.description: The ocean seeks to devour all, and the cultists rouse the vortex. Sea Terrors gladly rush forth, preying on the food caught within.

ro2_n_4_1.name: Underground Ascension
ro2_n_4_1.description: Some Seaborn have developed a rudimentary ability to fly. Though their progeny are unable to take to the blue skies, they have already leapt over chasms that humans cannot hope to cross in a lifetime.

ro2_n_4_2.name: Blaze of Glory
ro2_n_4_2.description:
A mental roasting is sometimes more terrifying than getting burnt alive, and the leader of the Tara is an unquenchable fire that scorches one's soul. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Heat Pump Passages> that periodically inflict damage to units standing on it.</>

ro2_n_4_3.name: Territorial Tendencies
ro2_n_4_3.description:
These irascible Originium slugs have lived here all their lives. To them, creatures from the outside fall into one of two camps: food, or intruders. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Heat Pump Passages> that periodically inflict damage to units standing on it.</>

ro2_n_4_4.name: Seacavern Sandstorm
ro2_n_4_4.description:
Nature does not provide the conditions for sandstorms to form inside caves, but Originium Arts can accomplish that. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Corrosive Ground> that halves the DEF of friendly units deployed on it.</>

ro2_n_4_5.name: Nethersea Brand Land
ro2_n_4_5.description:
For the Sea Terrors, this is of course a paradise. Were it possible, they would want the nethersea brand to spread across all of Terra. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage is filled with <Nethersea Brand> that continuously seeks to expand, inflicting damage and Nervous Impairment. Try to counteract it by making use of <Emergency Aid Buildings> and <Active Originium>.</>

ro2_n_4_6.name: Hunting Grounds
ro2_n_4_6.description: Based on the situation, it was clear who the prey was. Based on the results, it was also very clear who the hunter was.

ro2_n_4_7.name: The Revered Abyss
ro2_n_4_7.description:
If Seaborn are able to live in peace with the cultists, then it may indeed be possible for them to coexist with all of humanity. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Command Terminals> that will deplete Life Point if destroyed, and <Mobile Tactical Hangars> that launch enemy mercenary drones.</>

ro2_n_5_1.name: Mechanical Menace
ro2_n_5_1.description: In order to avoid being overrun by Sea Terrors, humanity has devised a set of mass extinction-level annihilation protocols for a swarm of unmanned drones. While this can indeed temporarily hold back the Sea Terrors, if it ever goes out of control...

ro2_n_5_2.name: The Faithful's Utopia
ro2_n_5_2.description:
While the Sea Terrors prey upon humans on land, some humans worship and protect them in the ocean's depths. It certainly reflects one aspect of the human race—whether you choose to call it diversity or inferiority is up to you. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Mobile Tactical Hangars> that launch enemy mercenary drones.</>

ro2_n_5_3.name: Out of Control
ro2_n_5_3.description: The Church of the Deep cultists afflicted by late-stage Oripathy demonstrated clearly to we many the threat that Originium could pose. But, we many will eventually adapt. It's only a matter of time.

ro2_n_5_4.name: The Piper's Call
ro2_n_5_4.description: The Seaborn do not need to evolve the ability to play and appreciate music, but certain individuals do wish to know why humans are so fascinated by it.

ro2_n_5_5.name: Ubi bona somnia
ro2_n_5_5.description:
Do Seaborn dream? And what do they dream of? We don't have answers to those questions, but we do know that they don't like being disturbed when they're resting. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_n_5_6.name: Pool of Procreation
ro2_n_5_6.description: Evolution is a gradual process. When a Seaborn continuously adapts and removes its own shortcomings, it will eventually become as perfect as a Leviathan.

ro2_n_5_7.name: The Spread
ro2_n_5_7.description:
Survival is the Seaborn's raison d'etre; therefore, no matter how aggressive and expansionary they may seem in the eyes of other species, to them, these behaviors will always be nothing more than survival. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Nethersea Brand> that continuously seeks to expand, inflicting damage and Nervous Impairment.</>

ro2_n_6_1.name: Water and Fire Union
ro2_n_6_1.description:
Volcanoes erupt, the ocean trembles, and sleeping creatures stir. Between molten lava and icy waters, life will continue to persist. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Corrosive Ground> that halves the DEF of friendly units deployed on it.</>

ro2_n_6_2.name: Deep Cognition
ro2_n_6_2.description:
Some Seaborn individuals have mimicked the humans' opposing forces to simulate external conflicts. With their learning ability and cohesive efficiency, the humans' so-called combined arms and tactical strategies will soon become meaningless. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage provides <Roadblocks> that can be deployed to block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_b_1.name: Requiem Aeternam
ro2_b_1.description:
Iberia is falling apart, and the Saint's life is coming to an end. He can no longer speak clearly, but as long as the aberrant sound within the sea still continues to ring, he will continue to fight. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Bushes> that prevent your units inside from being targeted by enemy ranged attacks.</>

ro2_b_1_b.name: Eternal Wrath
ro2_b_1_b.description:
An old man has witnessed the second destruction of his homeland, the bitterness and wrath in his heart exterminating his rationality. Slaughter is the only language he has left to express himself. 
<@rolv.rem>Only one round of Ammo is loaded. </>
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Bushes> that prevent your units inside from being targeted by enemy ranged attacks.</>

ro2_b_2.name: Separation and Unity
ro2_b_2.description: After being transformed by cutting-edge Ægir technology, this Bishop of the Deep now has two bodies unified by a single will. He has created a completely new form of life.

ro2_b_2_b.name: Two Forms, One Heart
ro2_b_2_b.description:
A Bishop of the Deep transformed a portion of his own flesh into a Seaborn connected with we many, allowing him to have a foot in both the human and Seaborn realms. 
<@rolv.rem>The Seaborn body has reduced HP, but attacks with greater ferocity.</>

ro2_b_3.name: Course Correction
ro2_b_3.description:
Regardless of whether or not it succeeds against your resistance, we many will learn their lesson and continue to move forward on their evolutionary path. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_b_3_b.name: Route Revision
ro2_b_3_b.description:
The Seaborn are not prophets—their evolutionary path is full of mistakes and losses. So they've evolved individuals adept in trial and error to prevent the collective from making the same mistake twice. 
<@rolv.rem>The number of hits required to spawn a Fractal is reduced. </>
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_b_4.name: Curse of Cognition
ro2_b_4.description: All things in existence are paradoxical, and those who wander within the boundaries of cognition are doomed to break apart. Until she reaffirms the meaning of her own existence, she will forever be a slave to her id.

ro2_b_5.name: 'Fate's Favored Child'
ro2_b_5.description:
Precisely because he is always fighting, fate continues to favor him, constantly throwing him into misery and calamity, and eagerly awaiting his undoing. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_b_6.name: Destiny of We Many
ro2_b_6.description: The fate of humankind, the Seaborn, Terra, and what remains of Skadi's humanity shall all be realized in this final moment.

ro2_b_8.name: Hunting Group
ro2_b_8.description: You’ve met a group of wasteland dwellers on a hunt. The group’s leader has targeted you with his crossbow—evidently, he doesn’t particularly care what his prey is.

ro2_b_9.name: Chilling Curse
ro2_b_9.description: Cruel frost, an innocent ballad, and the curse of the endless tundras coalesce into a Frozen Catastrophe that devours everything. <@rolv.rem>This stage has <Originium Ice Crystals> that periodically apply the Cold status in an area around them.</>

ro2_b_10.name: Avoid Unsafe Roads
ro2_b_10.description: At the conclusion of the conspiracy and sin, a 'gravestone' awaits you. It is time to end it all. <@rolv.rem>Friendly units have greatly reduced ATK and DEF; Natural DP regeneration is greatly reduced, and Redeployment Time is doubled.</>

ro2_t_1.name: Indecisiveness
ro2_t_1.description: He lacks any sense of initiative. If faced with a fork in the road, he'll spend half the day just thinking about which path to take.

ro2_t_2.name: Supervision Site
ro2_t_2.description:
Even after clocking out, these employees won't forget to set aside time to help the boss take care of some problems. As a reward, Duck Lord might even be willing to let them use the restroom during working hours? 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>

ro2_t_3.name: Right in the Kisser
ro2_t_3.description:
No matter how painful the lancers' thrusts or the broodmother's baleful spawns might be, is there anything that hurts as badly as Gopnik's punch? 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Active Originium> that greatly increases the ATK and ASPD of units that pass over it, but makes them lose HP over time.</>

ro2_t_4.name: Tail Between Legs
ro2_t_4.description: As annoying as this crybaby is, you have no choice but to admit that he's really good at making a getaway. <@rolv.rem>This stage has a <Detector> that can disable the Invisibility effect of nearby enemies.</>

ro2_t_5.name: A New Day, A New Duck
ro2_t_5.description: Since when did 'a little friction' between the two of you become such a commonplace occurrence?

ro2_ev_1.name: Reality
ro2_ev_1.description: Everyone has their own perspectives and a hill they're willing to die on. Now that a decision has been made, the consequences must be seen through to the end.

ro2_ev_2.name: Fanatical Flames
ro2_ev_2.description: The flames seethe and burn, like their untethered sanity, like the rage within your heart.

ro2_ev_3.name: 'Joy' From a Box
ro2_ev_3.description: Oh, a Sea Terror doubloon. Not bad, but is there anything more interesting in the chest? Like, a sculpture that spits out doubloons, or... a pure gold Sea Terror or something?

ro2_ev_4.name: Fishing in a Dry Pond
ro2_ev_4.description: As the old saying goes: 'Always spare some dignity around others, for you never know who you might meet again later.' But then you tell yourself—is there really any need to hold water for Cannot? <@rolv.rem>After victory, you may loot Cannot's shop</>

ro2_ev_5.name: See the Big Picture
ro2_ev_5.description: The journey is about to come to an end, and the denouement is about to be written. At a time like this, squeezing every drop of value from the merchant's wares is not out of the question. <@rolv.rem>After victory, you may loot Cannot's shop.</>

ro2_e_1_1.name: Cistern
ro2_e_1_1.description:
The scramble for fresh water highlights what once was a matter of trust. When water is no longer safe to drink, panic rips through the masses. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Deep Water Zones> that cause enemies inside to have reduced Movement Speed and continuously lose HP.</>
ro2_e_1_1.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_1_2.name: Insect Infestation
ro2_e_1_2.description: Apparently, insect swarms are better at detecting danger than humans, so what are these bugs trying to avoid?
ro2_e_1_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_1_3.name: Sniper Squad
ro2_e_1_3.description: Some archers have banded together to hunt along the coast. All living things are their prey.
ro2_e_1_3.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, and HP; additionally, certain enemies have enhanced abilities and gain invisibility.

ro2_e_1_4.name: Symbiosis
ro2_e_1_4.description: As long as it is conducive to the survival of the collective, we many sometimes allow non-Seaborn to coexist with the colony, even providing aid when necessary.
ro2_e_1_4.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_2_1.name: Voiceless Summons
ro2_e_2_1.description:
What is it that allows some humans to utilize Sea Terrors? Or, is this utilization nothing more than wishful thinking on the part of the humans? 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Bushes> that prevent your units inside from being targeted by enemy ranged attacks.</>
ro2_e_2_1.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_2_2.name: Leviathan's Followers
ro2_e_2_2.description:
Some Church of the Deep cultists have heard of a Leviathan that floats on the surface of the ocean like an iceberg, so naturally they worship it as an avatar of ice and snow. But naturally, they have no idea what 'ice and snow' truly are, considering they've never seen it before. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Originium Ice Crystals> that periodically apply the Cold status in an area around them.</>
ro2_e_2_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; the configuration of devices on this stage will be changed

ro2_e_2_3.name: Malady
ro2_e_2_3.description:
The land's malady cannot infect the ocean, but the islands above the water's surface are still its playthings. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Originium Altars> that periodically damage friendly and enemy units around them.</>
ro2_e_2_3.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; certain tiles are no longer available for deployment

ro2_e_2_4.name: Omen
ro2_e_2_4.description: The Church of the Deep cultists have brought a Sea Terror following its reproductive instincts ashore. If not dealt with promptly, there will be a small tide of Sea Terrors in the surrounding area within a few days.
ro2_e_2_4.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_2_5.name: Ebb
ro2_e_2_5.description: Some Sea Terrors have behaviors that match the regularity of the tide's ebb and flow. Observant Hunters use this as an opportunity to go forth and eliminate them.
ro2_e_2_5.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, HP, and Movement Speed

ro2_e_3_1.name: Crime and Punishment
ro2_e_3_1.description: These rogues were unable to extract any wealth from the Sea Terrors, so they turned their blades on their fellow men. This time, they struck a sheet of metal.
ro2_e_3_1.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_3_2.name: Troglodyte Tribe
ro2_e_3_2.description:
They are crueler, more intractable, and more belligerent than their Sargonian kin. So save your breath and pick up your weapons. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Active Originium> that greatly increases the ATK and ASPD of units that pass over it, but makes them lose HP over time.</>
ro2_e_3_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_3_3.name: Craft Brewer Killer
ro2_e_3_3.description: Faced with a past-due shipment, a broken-down car, and now a swarm of Sea Terrors drunk off his slated-for-delivery craft brews, his insanity seems rather justifiable.
ro2_e_3_3.eliteDesc: Condition: DP regenerate rate is reduced; enemies have greatly increased ATK and HP

ro2_e_3_4.name: Sanguinarch's Legacy
ro2_e_3_4.description: There may not be much of a difference between blood and seawater, at least in form. Therefore, anywhere the azure waves still ripple, the Sanguinarch's offspring can still survive.
ro2_e_3_4.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_3_5.name: Precarious Defense
ro2_e_3_5.description: With the proper tactical decisions and everyone's mutual support, there may yet be a way to survive this savagery and madness.
ro2_e_3_5.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_3_6.name: The Nest
ro2_e_3_6.description: The Sea Terror's nest extends in all directions, and intruders quickly find themselves trapped from two sides. By the time they manage to kill one that volunteered itself to stay behind as distraction, its kin have long since relocated.
ro2_e_3_6.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; additionally, certain enemies have greatly increased ATK and ASPD

ro2_e_3_7.name: Vortex
ro2_e_3_7.description: The ocean seeks to devour all, and the cultists rouse the vortex. Sea Terrors gladly rush forth, preying on the food caught within.
ro2_e_3_7.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, HP, and Movement Speed

ro2_e_4_1.name: Underground Ascension
ro2_e_4_1.description: Some Seaborn have developed a rudimentary ability to fly. Though their progeny are unable to take to the blue skies, they have already leapt over chasms that humans cannot hope to cross in a lifetime.
ro2_e_4_1.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK and HP; additionally, certain enemies have greatly increased HP.

ro2_e_4_2.name: Blaze of Glory
ro2_e_4_2.description:
A mental roasting is sometimes more terrifying than getting burnt alive, and the leader of the Tara is an unquenchable fire that scorches one's soul. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Heat Pump Passages> that periodically inflict damage to units standing on it.</>
ro2_e_4_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK and HP; the effects of certain terrain are enhanced

ro2_e_4_3.name: Territorial Tendencies
ro2_e_4_3.description:
These irascible Originium slugs have lived here all their lives. To them, creatures from the outside fall into one of two camps: food, or intruders. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Heat Pump Passages> that periodically inflict damage to units standing on it.</>
ro2_e_4_3.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; additionally, certain enemies have increased Attack Range and Movement Speed

ro2_e_4_4.name: Seacavern Sandstorm
ro2_e_4_4.description:
Nature does not provide the conditions for sandstorms to form inside caves, but Originium Arts can accomplish that. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Corrosive Ground> that halves the DEF of friendly units deployed on it.</>
ro2_e_4_4.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK and HP; additionally, certain enemies have greatly increased DEF.

ro2_e_4_5.name: Nethersea Brand Land
ro2_e_4_5.description:
For the Sea Terrors, this is of course a paradise. Were it possible, they would want the nethersea brand to spread across all of Terra. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage is filled with <Nethersea Brand> that continuously seeks to expand, inflicting damage and Nervous Impairment. Try to counteract it by making use of <Emergency Aid Buildings> and <Active Originium>.</>
ro2_e_4_5.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased HP; additionally, the abilities of certain enemies are enhanced

ro2_e_4_6.name: Hunting Grounds
ro2_e_4_6.description: Based on the situation, it was clear who the prey was. Based on the results, it was also very clear who the hunter was.
ro2_e_4_6.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; certain tiles are no longer available for deployment

ro2_e_4_7.name: The Revered Abyss
ro2_e_4_7.description:
If Seaborn are able to live in peace with the cultists, then it may indeed be possible for them to coexist with all of humanity. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Command Terminals> that will deplete Life Point if destroyed, and <Mobile Tactical Hangars> that launch enemy mercenary drones.</>
ro2_e_4_7.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; the configuration of devices on this stage will be changed

ro2_e_5_1.name: Mechanical Menace
ro2_e_5_1.description: In order to avoid being overrun by Sea Terrors, humanity has devised a set of mass extinction-level annihilation protocols for a swarm of unmanned drones. While this can indeed temporarily hold back the Sea Terrors, if it ever goes out of control...
ro2_e_5_1.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_5_2.name: The Faithful's Utopia
ro2_e_5_2.description:
While the Sea Terrors prey upon humans on land, some humans worship and protect them in the ocean's depths. It certainly reflects one aspect of the human race—whether you choose to call it diversity or inferiority is up to you. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Mobile Tactical Hangars> that launch enemy mercenary drones.</>
ro2_e_5_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_5_3.name: Out of Control
ro2_e_5_3.description: The Church of the Deep cultists afflicted by late-stage Oripathy demonstrated clearly to we many the threat that Originium could pose. But, we many will eventually adapt. It's only a matter of time.
ro2_e_5_3.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have significantly increased ATK, DEF, HP, ASPD, and Movement Speed

ro2_e_5_4.name: The Piper's Call
ro2_e_5_4.description: The Seaborn do not need to evolve the ability to play and appreciate music, but certain individuals do wish to know why humans are so fascinated by it.
ro2_e_5_4.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; new Elite enemies will appear

ro2_e_5_5.name: Ubi bona somnia
ro2_e_5_5.description:
Do Seaborn dream? And what do they dream of? We don't have answers to those questions, but we do know that they don't like being disturbed when they're resting. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Rubble> that can block the enemy's path.</>
ro2_e_5_5.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased HP and Movement Speed

ro2_e_5_6.name: Pool of Procreation
ro2_e_5_6.description: Evolution is a gradual process. When a Seaborn continuously adapts and removes its own shortcomings, it will eventually become as perfect as a Leviathan.
ro2_e_5_6.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP

ro2_e_5_7.name: The Spread
ro2_e_5_7.description:
Survival is the Seaborn's raison d'etre; therefore, no matter how aggressive and expansionary they may seem in the eyes of other species, to them, these behaviors will always be nothing more than survival. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Nethersea Brand> that continuously seeks to expand, inflicting damage and Nervous Impairment.</>
ro2_e_5_7.eliteDesc: Condition: More Elite enemies will appear, and enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; additionally, certain enemies have greatly increased HP.

ro2_e_6_1.name: Water and Fire Union
ro2_e_6_1.description:
Volcanoes erupt, the ocean trembles, and sleeping creatures stir. Between molten lava and icy waters, life will continue to persist. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage has <Corrosive Ground> that halves the DEF of friendly units deployed on it.</>
ro2_e_6_1.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have increased ATK, DEF, and HP; additionally, certain enemies have greatly increased Attack Range

ro2_e_6_2.name: Deep Cognition
ro2_e_6_2.description:
Some Seaborn individuals have mimicked the humans' opposing forces to simulate external conflicts. With their learning ability and cohesive efficiency, the humans' so-called combined arms and tactical strategies will soon become meaningless. 
<@rolv.rem>This stage provides <Roadblocks> that can be deployed to block the enemy's path.</>
ro2_e_6_2.eliteDesc: Condition: Enemies have greatly increased ATK, DEF, and HP

zone_1.name: Sunshine Coast
zone_1.description: The waves pass the steps devoid of footprints, the foam soaking the bricks at the base of the wall. This is a form of clamorous silence, where the land and the sea join in harmony.
zone_1.endingDescription: The wind and waves wrap around your ankles, gently pulling you away from the land and into its embrace.

zone_2.name: Offshore Island
zone_2.description: This island is not far from shore, but nobody knows how it came to be. The ocean wind pushes ajar the doors of the buildings here, light and shadow interweaving... Go on—enter, and take a look.
zone_2.endingDescription: A spark of light inside a building is the best way to lure in visitors. As long as they take the bait, this isolated island far from civilization will still be able to feast.

zone_3.name: Raging Billows
zone_3.description: The sky darkens, those dangerously beautiful tides shimmering as they gradually become clearer. They quietly spread towards the mouth of the cave on the island, right at our feet.
zone_3.endingDescription: The water rises, sealing the entrance to the cave. The tide stretches its limbs, grabbing onto its prey.

zone_4.name: Secret Hotbed
zone_4.description: Deeper inside the cave, the moss creeping along the rock walls begins to proliferate wildly, covering the entire surface. Life does not require the light of day to thrive.
zone_4.endingDescription: In places devoid of light, survival is the sole impetus of life. Should you fail to come to terms with this reality, then you will be completely devoured by the life here.

zone_5.name: Sacrosanct Cave
zone_5.description: The ocean current abruptly veers here, the sound of the rushing tide resembling that of crying. They seem to have been deliberately avoiding this place... Apparently, nature is not the only inhabitant here.
zone_5.endingDescription: A true predator never needs to take action. The invisible helping hand of curiosity will naturally push the next meal into its mouth.

zone_6.name: Deep Sea Woodland
zone_6.description: The sound of plants breathing resonates at the same frequency, and countless motes of fluorescent light rise amidst the forest like a galaxy hanging upside-down on the ocean floor. What kind of soil could give rise to such a wondrous grove?
zone_6.endingDescription: You applaud nature, but nature only finds you to be noisy. Nevertheless, it will still take you in, whether you agree to it or not.

zone_7.name: Indigo Cradle
zone_7.description: Time. Time. Time is their sustenance. Across lengths of time immeasurable, the cerulean branches continue to linger and grow, and thus does life sway and unfurl. This place has everything, and nurtures all.
zone_7.endingDescription: Everything around you is a vibrant cerulean, and you can no longer find any way to escape. The age of plants is boundless, and you have reached the end of this futile search.

rogue_2_active_tool_1.trapDesc: Regenerates additional SP for a character or Command Terminal

rogue_2_active_tool_2.trapDesc: Upon explosion, deals heavy damage to enemies in the surrounding 4 tiles and amplifies the damage they take for a period of time

rogue_2_active_tool_3.trapDesc: Stuns all enemies in the four adjacent tiles for a long duration

rogue_2_active_tool_4.trapDesc: Immediately retreats the targeted Operator and significantly reduces their Redeployment Time

rogue_2_dice_battle1.trapDesc: A six-sided die that can be used in battle

rogue_2_dice_battle2.trapDesc: An eight-sided die that can be used in battle

rogue_2_dice_battle3.trapDesc: A twelve-sided die that can be used in battle

rogue_2_custom_ticket_purify.discardText: Stop trying to suppress the Rejection?

recruit_group_random.name: As Your Heart Desires
recruit_group_random.desc: Three random Recruitment Vouchers with one 4-star Temporary Recruitment guaranteed
recruit_group_random.unlockDesc: Conduct an exploration using other Recruitment Sets

recruit_group_1.name: First Move Advantage
recruit_group_1.desc: Vanguard, Sniper, and Specialist Recruitment Vouchers (one each)

recruit_group_2.name: Slow and Steady Wins the Race
recruit_group_2.desc: Defender, Caster, and Sniper Recruitment Vouchers (one each)

recruit_group_3.name: Overcoming Your Weaknesses
recruit_group_3.desc: Guard, Supporter, Medic Recruitment Vouchers (one each)

recruit_group_c4.name: Suppressive Fire
recruit_group_c4.desc: 2 each of Sniper and Caster Recruitment Vouchers, two of which are guaranteed to contain 4* Temporary Recruitment operators

recruit_group_c5.name: Ground Offensive
recruit_group_c5.desc: 2 each of Guard and Defender Recruitment Vouchers, two of which are guaranteed to contain 4* Temporary Recruitment operators

choice_ro2_startbuff_4.title: Purchase a Collectible
choice_ro2_startbuff_4.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>all</> Originium Ingots, but obtain a random Collectible

choice_ro2_startbuff_5.title: Reclaim loot
choice_ro2_startbuff_5.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>1</> Hope and Max Hope, but obtain a random Collectible

choice_ro2_startbuff_6.title: Just grab something
choice_ro2_startbuff_6.description: Obtain a <@ro2.get>Hot Water Kettle</> (Immediately gain +1 Max Life Point and +1 Hope)

choice_ro2_wish_1.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it.
choice_ro2_wish_1.description: You have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_wish_2.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it.
choice_ro2_wish_2.description: You have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_wish_3.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it.
choice_ro2_wish_3.description: You have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_wish_4.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it from under the table.
choice_ro2_wish_4.description: Resourceful: Using your knowledge of Iberian customs, you have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_wish_5.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it from under the table.
choice_ro2_wish_5.description: Resourceful: Using your knowledge of Iberian customs, you have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_wish_6.title: Take the fin with a wish strip attached to it from under the table.
choice_ro2_wish_6.description: Resourceful: Using your knowledge of Iberian customs, you have a chance to obtain this Collectible

choice_ro2_dice_1.title: Stop to pray
choice_ro2_dice_1.description: Gain <@ro2.get>1</> Die Roll and <@ro2.get>4</> Originium Ingots

choice_ro2_grace_1.title: Retrieve what the Seaborn was protecting

choice_ro2_recruit1_1.title: Entertain him
choice_ro2_recruit1_1.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>2</> Originium Ingots, but recruit one Operator (from a selection of 2 random classes)

choice_ro2_recruit1_2.title: Make a large contribution
choice_ro2_recruit1_2.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>5</> Originium Ingots, but recruit any Operator

choice_ro2_recruit2_1.title: Sleep soundly
choice_ro2_recruit2_1.description: Recruit one Operator (from a selection of 2 random classes)

choice_ro2_recruit2_2.title: Maintain a rotating night shift
choice_ro2_recruit2_2.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>10</> Light, but obtain a Recruitment Voucher

choice_ro2_trade3_1.title: Why not give it a try?
choice_ro2_trade3_1.description: Obtain a random Collectible, but it probably isn't anything good

choice_ro2_2_1.title: Stop and listen
choice_ro2_2_1.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>3</> Originium Ingots, but randomly obtain a mysterious Collectible

choice_ro2_2_2.title: Turn and leave
choice_ro2_2_2.description: Don't overthink things; just cover your ears

choice_ro2_trade2_1.title: Buy a few to sample the taste
choice_ro2_trade2_1.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>5</> Originium Ingots, but gain <@ro2.get>3</> Hope

choice_ro2_4_3.title: Opt to choose neither
choice_ro2_4_3.description: These weapons are hard to lug around

choice_ro2_1_1.title: Take the risk to help him recover his equipment
choice_ro2_1_1.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>1</> Life Point, but randomly obtain a mysterious Collectible

choice_ro2_1_2.title: Ask him about what he's seen

choice_ro2_5_1.title: Purchase the instrument
choice_ro2_5_1.description: Lose all Originium Ingots, but obtain the Collectible

choice_ro2_5_2.title: Try out the instrument
choice_ro2_5_2.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>5</> Life Point, but obtain the Collectible

choice_ro2_5_3.title: Sounds a little sketchy...
choice_ro2_5_3.description: Can't rely on someone like this

choice_ro2_6_9.title: It looks pretty, but unfortunately doesn't seem useful

choice_ro2_6_10.title: Maybe next time
choice_ro2_6_10.description: Originium Ingots don't grow on trees

choice_ro2_blood1_1.title: Take the risk to go retrieve it
choice_ro2_blood1_1.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>3</> Life Point, but obtain the Collectible

choice_ro2_blood1_2.title: Scavenge for supplies from a safe area

choice_ro2_blood2_2.title: Quietly approach
choice_ro2_blood2_2.description: Lose <@ro2.lose>2</> Life Point, but gain <@ro2.get>15</> Light

scene_ro2_startbuff_enter.title: Operation Rewards
scene_ro2_startbuff_enter.description: Your overcame at least two floors in your last exploration. You'll be able to receive more assistance this time

scene_ro2_wish_enter.title: Bygone Customs
scene_ro2_wish_enter.description: Back in the days when the fincatching boats still sailed, children in coastal Iberian villages would make a wish for their parents who went out to sea to return with a gift. When the adults returned, they would personally hand over the largest finbeast to their children, its belly stuffed with whatever they wished for, or some other surprise. Apparently, children in wealthier families could make more than one wish, but now, all that remains before you are a few dried finbeasts with wish strips attached.

scene_ro2_wish_1.title: Bygone Customs
scene_ro2_wish_1.description: Regardless of what was hidden inside the finbeast, this custom was, in essence, a way of preserving the Iberians' best wishes for the future. And now, those sentiments have disappeared in the wake of the Profound Silence.

scene_ro2_rest_enter.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_enter.description: The resources that Rhodes Island has in Iberia prohibit it from building safe houses as comprehensive as those in other regions, but functionally, there is no difference between them. For the time being, the cold and the damp are staved off, the flames dance, and fresh food steams. Rest well, and prepare yourself, for greater waves are still ahead.

scene_ro2_rest_1.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_1.description: You cannot hear the sound of the tide here. Sleep well, sleep well.

scene_ro2_rest_2.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_2.description: Ships must be properly maintained before they can set sail, and the same is true of operators.

scene_ro2_rest_3.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_3.description: The former glory of Iberia, the mysterious Ægir, and legends of the sea—some fascinating stories can always be exchanged for lively discussion.

scene_ro2_rest_4.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_4.description: With numbers comes strength, as long as there are enough supplies. Planning early to accommodate additional manpower is never a bad idea.

scene_ro2_rest_5.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_5.description: Offering a prayer to an object of unknown faith is perhaps a good way to inadvertently change your fate.

scene_ro2_rest_6.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_6.description: After adding fuel to the lantern, the candle burns brighter.

scene_ro2_rest_7.title: Safe House
scene_ro2_rest_7.description: The resources that Rhodes Island has in Iberia prohibit it from building safe houses as comprehensive as those in other regions, but functionally, there is no difference between them. For the time being, the cold and the damp are staved off, the flames dance, and fresh food steams. Rest well, and prepare yourself, for greater waves are still ahead.
