scene_ro2_rest_13.description: After adding fuel to the lantern, the candle burns brighter.

scene_ro2_dice_enter.title: Cliffside Burial
scene_ro2_dice_enter.description: You are standing in a cliffside cemetery, where a farewell ceremony is being held. The people of the sea will burn the body, let the sea wind carry away the ashes, then erect a coffin at that spot to serve as a tombstone for mourning. You vaguely recall that the ceremony of these people used to be burial out at sea, but this one is clearly a rejection of the ocean. The cognitive dissonance leaves you somewhat puzzled, but you still stop for a while to offer your prayers to those who have passed on.

scene_ro2_dice_1.title: Cliffside Burial
scene_ro2_dice_1.description: After the prayer ends, you look up to the bottom of the cliff. At that moment, you understand why people are leaving the ocean—its surface is covered with the nethersea brand, and it is spreading towards the cliffs. It is not that they do not miss the sea; rather, it is the sea that has rejected them.

scene_ro2_grace_enter.title: Inheritance
scene_ro2_grace_enter.description: There is a dead Seaborn by the shore. Though its body is shriveled, it seems to be clutching tightly onto something, unwilling to let go.

scene_ro2_grace_1.title: Inheritance
scene_ro2_grace_1.description:
When you touch the object, several fragmented scenes flash through your mind: 
'A living forest built atop the ruins of the city, some of its kin having evolved the ability to digest metal.' 
'Humans offering food, humans becoming food.' 
'A human giving a fragile terrestrial plant to the Seaborn; it quickly withers.' 
'The first words that the Seaborn learned after evolving vocal organs were 'gift' and 'friend.''

scene_ro2_recruit1_enter.title: Homecoming
scene_ro2_recruit1_enter.description: You run into the priest while looking for the Messenger station. He claims to have been away from Iberia for a long time, pursuing truth all across the land, but is now returning to offer some assistance to his homeland. He is willing to help you contact local operators, but also emphasizes that the road ahead is tough, and all he can do is make contact.

scene_ro2_recruit1_1.title: Homecoming
scene_ro2_recruit1_1.description: You take out a few coins and stuff them into the priest's hands, and he sets out on the road home after offering you his courtesies.

scene_ro2_recruit1_2.title: Homecoming
scene_ro2_recruit1_2.description: The sum you set aside for him is enough to allow him to return to Iberia safely, and he thanks you with a smile. When you ask what he seeks to accomplish on his return, the priest tells you that he fled from the sea because he was afraid, but now, he is ready.

scene_ro2_recruit1_3.title: Homecoming
scene_ro2_recruit1_3.description: The priest is stunned for a moment when he sees you offer an Iberian prayer, but afterwards, he affirms that he will carry out this job for you. Before leaving, he takes out a piece of paper and writes down his address, hoping you can find him upon your return to Iberia. However, there are no words on the paper—only a faint fragrance.

scene_ro2_recruit2_enter.title: Like Flames to Wood
scene_ro2_recruit2_enter.description: While collecting firewood, you discover a strange forest. The trees here have no leaves, and their bark is thin and transparent, as smooth as skin. When you scratch one with a knife, a strangely-scented resin flows forth. You chop a few branches before heading back. At night, the bonfire in the darkness attracts many lost travelers, and you take them in. Everyone says that as you were the one to bring this flame, you needn't worry about the night vigil.

scene_ro2_recruit2_1.title: Like Flames to Wood
scene_ro2_recruit2_1.description: When you wake up, you find that you slept so deeply that all traces of fatigue are gone. The bonfire has been extinguished, and last night's travelers are nowhere to be seen. They didn't even bother saying goodbye?

scene_ro2_recruit2_2.title: Like Flames to Wood
scene_ro2_recruit2_2.description: While listening to the snoring of the others, even you start to doze off. At some point, you suddenly awaken, with the travelers nowhere to be found and the sound of something screaming periodically ringing in your ears. Suddenly, the bonfire spreads in all directions. The 'branches' leap out in the direction of the 'trees,' and the entire forest begins to roar. You realize that something is terribly wrong, so you quickly pack your bags and scamper away.

scene_ro2_up1_enter.title: Advance Squad
scene_ro2_up1_enter.description: You locate the Rhodes Island squad that sent out the original distress signal. Its members have been scouting the surrounding areas before you made contact. You exchange information, and they share some of their resources and experience with you.

scene_ro2_up1_1.title: Advance Squad
scene_ro2_up1_1.description: You have learned much from the squad, and it is time to continue your exploration.

scene_ro2_up2_enter.title: Lighthouse Keeper
scene_ro2_up2_enter.description: An old man drew a lighthouse in the sand, but the surging tide quickly erases all traces of it. 'The ocean really swallowed them all up this time,' he mutters to himself. You strike up a conversation with him, who as you might imagine was formerly one of Iberia's many lighthouse keepers. You find out that he came here for a reunion with old friends. 'Were they all lighthouse keepers as well?' 'They are now.' Before you leave, the old man hands you some specialties as a parting gift.

scene_ro2_up2_1.title: Lighthouse Keeper
scene_ro2_up2_1.description: The nethersea brand has devoured the light that this country was once so proud of. The last lighthouse of Iberia has rotted away and collapsed, and the dust of history has settled. Is this gathering of lighthouse keepers just for old times' sake? You feel like something doesn't quite add up, but he's already a long ways away. How strange. Are old folks supposed to be that fleet-footed?

scene_ro2_trade3_enter.title: Seaborn Scholar
scene_ro2_trade3_enter.description: An old Ægir is currently expounding to you on how to deal with the Seaborn. According to him, he used to specialize in Seaborn behavior at a scientific academy, but the academy was destroyed by the Seaborn, and he was swept away from home by the ocean currents. Fortunately, there are also people here who are fighting the Seaborn, so his research can still be put to good use. Now, he has made equipment from the carcasses of some Sea Terrors he collected, and hopes you can use it to gather more data for his experiment.

scene_ro2_trade3_1.title: Seaborn Scholar
scene_ro2_trade3_1.description: He smiles with great gratification as you accept his experimental device. He explains to you the key points of using it before finally tacking on a note of caution at the very end: 'If this thing comes to life, it must be destroyed immediately. Understand?'

scene_ro2_trade3_2.title: Seaborn Scholar
scene_ro2_trade3_2.description: If his research was so useful, his city wouldn't have been destroyed, so you refuse to be his test subject.

scene_ro2_2_enter.title: Singer by the Sea
scene_ro2_2_enter.description: A solitary Sea Terror sings its dying elegy as it lies on the reef, its tentacles flicking away at a human musical instrument. The discordant notes of the harp and the euphonious melody of its song resound together between heaven and earth.

scene_ro2_2_1.title: Singer by the Sea
scene_ro2_2_1.description: The song attracts its brethren, and the sound of chewing eventually overwhelms the melody. When they separate and you step out onto the reef, nothing remains except traces of that final performance. Take them with you, and begone from this place.

scene_ro2_2_2.title: Singer by the Sea
scene_ro2_2_2.description: Though singing can invariably tug at a person's heartstrings, these are not the sounds of a human being, and it is ultimately better to avert your ears.

scene_ro2_trade2_enter.title: Overseas Export
scene_ro2_trade2_enter.description: You see an RV on the side of the road. A Columbian from the vehicle is currently hawking beer while scraping the logos off the bottles.

scene_ro2_trade2_1.title: Overseas Export
scene_ro2_trade2_1.description: Only one sip, and you already know where this Originium slug craft beer comes from. But when you ask how the boss's business has been recently, the Columbian talks in circles for a while, but eventually sighs and tells you that Bob was caught by the Columbian tax bureau and thrown into jail.

scene_ro2_trade2_2.title: Overseas Export
scene_ro2_trade2_2.description: You describe to them the dangers of Iberia and suggest that they take their business to another country. The Columbian thanks you, gifts you a few bottles of beer, and drives off in a hurry.

scene_ro2_trade2_3.title: Overseas Export
scene_ro2_trade2_3.description: You describe to them the dangers of Iberia and suggest that they take their business to another country. The Columbian thanks you before driving off in a hurry.

scene_ro2_4_enter.title: Traditional Technology
scene_ro2_4_enter.description: While exploring a cave, you run into an old man who is maintaining two weapons far too large for him. 'I am a craftsman, and I'm preparing weapons for my Hunters.' He pauses for a while, before continuing: 'Ægir no longer has any Hunters; it only has me, a useless old man.' He clenches his fist tightly, using this to cover up his inner rage. 'You're also a warrior, right? Then take one of these weapons, and treat it as a token of our meeting.'

scene_ro2_4_1.title: Traditional Technology
scene_ro2_4_1.description: 'You've got good taste, kid. He and his Hunter were unrivaled when it came to smashing the Seaborn to pieces. Though he's a bit heavy, you've got nothing to worry about as long as you can lift him. He won't break.'

scene_ro2_4_2.title: Traditional Technology
scene_ro2_4_2.description: 'Light and deadly, isn't she? Just like her former master. Identify the vital point, poke a hole in it, and even those beasts won't be able to float anymore. Hahaha!'

scene_ro2_4_3.title: Traditional Technology
scene_ro2_4_3.description: 'True... True... How could a landwalker ever wield a Hunter's weapon? Begone, stranger, and never come back.'

scene_ro2_1_enter.title: The Last Tidewatcher
scene_ro2_1_enter.description: A lone Ægir stands against the tide. The turbid waves coalesce into high walls and come crashing down on the cliff beneath his feet again and again, nearly swallowing it several times over. However, the man does not retreat even half a step. The waves carry away two pieces of equipment at his feet, and you recognize them—one is a 'Verticis Navis,' a short-range submersible, and the other is an 'Ocean Voyager,' a device used to mark territory—two instruments frequently used by Ægir tidewatchers.

scene_ro2_1_1.title: The Last Tidewatcher
scene_ro2_1_1.description: You are soaked from head to toe, but the man expresses his gratitude. After the war, the Ægir who were forced to go ashore were just as ashamed as the 'Islanders' back then, but they still selected tidewatchers in hopes of reconnecting with the ocean. They are the outposts searching for their homeland, the 'Eyes of Ægir,' humanity's last line of defense. But just as the tides silenced the lighthouses of Iberia, he is the last remaining tidewatcher. The man has no intention of leaving, and you propose taking a piece of his equipment with you in his memory. 'People must remember the tidewatchers, and know of the calamity that they never witnessed.' The man stares at you for a long time, then nods.

scene_ro2_1_2.title: The Last Tidewatcher
scene_ro2_1_2.description: 'Turmoil... Turmoil... Irregularity. This is the fifth tsunami in the last half year, and each time the tide recedes, I realize that the hopes of returning to Ægir grow slimmer and slimmer. But I want to stay. Somebody must record what exactly is happening at the center of the ocean, up until the final moment.' The man speaks with an abnormal calmness, lights a fire, and cooks some broth to share with you. You are unable to read any signs of panic in his expression, or any other emotions for that matter. He stands as resolute as rock, and that infects you as well.

scene_ro2_1_3.title: The Last Tidewatcher
scene_ro2_1_3.description: The wind and the waves have calmed, meaning that the next round of tides is coming. The tidewatcher has no intention of talking to you, urging you to leave as soon as possible to avoid danger.

scene_ro2_5_enter.title: The Wares Peddler
scene_ro2_5_enter.description: An Ægir is showing you an exquisite instrument. According to him, it is capable of monitoring ocean currents to infer changes in marine life, worthy of its status as one of Ægir's secret treasures. 'I've been stuck here for years with nobody to lead us back home. Ægir... no longer exists. He's heard that the most powerful country on land is called Victoria, and he plans to use the money from selling treasures to buy himself some supplies and start a new life there.

scene_ro2_5_1.title: The Wares Peddler
scene_ro2_5_1.description: This Ægir seems particularly adept at estimating just how much people can stomach, and he doesn't hand you the instrument until he's extracted every last coin from your pocket. As you watch his back fade into the distance, you can't help but remember your friends from the deep sea. Even they, to this day, have never become fully accustomed to life on land. Will he be able to become a successful landwalker? Nobody can say for sure.

scene_ro2_5_2.title: The Wares Peddler
scene_ro2_5_2.description: Following the instructions of the Ægir, you try dipping the instrument into the sea, and the water pattern on the surface of the device suddenly starts fluctuating. That means... there are swarms of Sea Terrors nearby! After a great struggle, you finally dispatch the monsters and flee into a safe cave. The instrument is still in your hands, but the Ægir is long gone.

scene_ro2_5_3.title: The Wares Peddler
scene_ro2_5_3.description: A member of your party interrupts your conversation to remind you that his description is greatly exaggerated, and that this instrument may not be all that special in Ægir.

scene_ro2_6_enter.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_enter.description: You find a scientific research facility in a cave deep in the ocean. Most of the devices here have been damaged, and you can't discern their functions at all. Only one terminal can be booted up.

scene_ro2_6_1.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_1.description: After being supplied with power, the terminal just barely flickers to life, its existing power supply not estimated to last long. Better start reading through the interesting files as soon as possible.

scene_ro2_6_2.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_2.description: A few lines of text pop up on the terminal: 'Project: Survival. Objective: Collection of nutrients, efficient allocation of resources. Permission to use this matrix has been granted to relevant personnel.'

scene_ro2_6_3.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_3.description: A few lines of text pop up on the terminal: 'Project: Migration. Objective: Expansion of territory, seizing of resources. Permission to use this matrix has been granted to relevant personnel.'

scene_ro2_6_4.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_4.description: A few lines of text pop up on the terminal: 'Project: Reproduction. Objective: Efficient propagation, consumption of resources. Permission to use this matrix has been granted to relevant personnel.'

scene_ro2_6_5.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_5.description: A few lines of text pop up on the terminal: 'Project: Growth. Objective: Provide nutrition, produce resources. Permission to use this matrix has been granted to relevant personnel.' However, after a long wait, what appears in front of your eyes is a picture book. Inside are hand-drawn depictions of dozens of marine animals and plants that seem familiar to you. Other than this, you don't find any useful materials.

scene_ro2_6_6.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_6.description: Probably just another failed Ægir lab. There's no need to waste time here.

scene_ro2_6_7.title: Ignorance is Bliss
scene_ro2_6_7.description: You have no way of interacting with these so-called projects at all. Maybe the researchers here weren't able to make any significant progress before the facility was shut down.

scene_ro2_blood1_enter.title: A Faint Spark
scene_ro2_blood1_enter.description: The devouring dust has already blanketed the entire city, digesting the products of civilization in an orderly manner to turn them into sustenance for the Seaborn's progeny and evolution. You trudge through the dissolving ruins, searching for any supplies that might still be usable. Unintentionally, your attention is drawn to something glowing from beneath a patch of dust.

scene_ro2_blood1_1.title: A Faint Spark
scene_ro2_blood1_1.description: After risking life and limb to remove the dust, you find a severely corroded lantern. Even so, the flame inside still shines with a warm light.

scene_ro2_blood1_2.title: A Faint Spark
scene_ro2_blood1_2.description: After scrounging together some valuable items, you leave in a hurry. A few hours later, there is no longer a city remaining.

scene_ro2_blood2_enter.title: Lingering Glimmer
scene_ro2_blood2_enter.description: You see an Inquisitor who has lost her lantern. She gasps for breath as she leans against her sword, a mountain of Sea Terror corpses at her feet.

scene_ro2_blood2_1.title: Lingering Glimmer
scene_ro2_blood2_1.description: 'This is... my Maestro's lantern...' The Inquisitor receives the lantern from your hands, and thanks you. 'I'm glad... we could meet again... Now, go. It's not... safe here.' At that moment, you see her tuck her hand without a sword into her sleeves, trying hard to control the squirming. 'Leave... I will light the way for you... one last time...'

scene_ro2_blood2_2.title: Lingering Glimmer
scene_ro2_blood2_2.description: The Inquisitor mistakes you for a Sea Terror while you are sneaking around, and the tip of her sword leaves a trail of blood on you. Once she learns that you were looking for help, she shows you the way.

scene_ro2_blood2_3.title: Lingering Glimmer
scene_ro2_blood2_3.description: The Inquisitor doesn't seem to have enough strength left to speak. She simply listens to your words, nodding from time to time, then watches you leave.

scene_ro2_trade1_enter.title: Chance Meeting
scene_ro2_trade1_enter.description: You accidentally barge into a cave while trying to avoid the storm's sudden onset, where you find a gravely wounded Sea Terror. No, rather... it is an imperfect splicing between man and Sea Terror, with fragments of a priest's uniform still hanging from its body. The moment it sees you, a gleam of light flashes within its dying eyes.

scene_ro2_trade1_1.title: Chance Meeting
scene_ro2_trade1_1.description: The aberration in front of you emits a noxious gas. It is dying, and only empty darkness lingers in its only remaining human eye. As you recall, there was a pious priest who returned to Iberia full of conviction. You can only hope he will not die a lonely death devoid of dignity, like the priest in front of you.

scene_ro2_trade1_2.title: Chance Meeting
scene_ro2_trade1_2.description: You fight your way through the choking mist in an attempt to save him, but he shows no physical response, simply staring at you blankly through his human eye. There is no hope within it, no despair, only a deathly peace. After a few minutes, the light in his eyes finally extinguishes. For some reason, you decide to send his body into the ocean, rather than leaving it in this dark cave to become rations for the Sea Terrors.

scene_ro2_trade1_3.title: Chance Meeting
scene_ro2_trade1_3.description: You have little interest in monsters that are neither human nor Sea Terror. However, it will attract other Sea Terrors, so it is best to get out of here as soon as possible.

scene_ro2_hp_enter.title: Camp
scene_ro2_hp_enter.description: You find a quiet corner safe enough to harbor your entire squad from harm, allowing you to rest and reorganize. After you help your teammates get settled in, your nerves start to unwind as well.

scene_ro2_hp_1.title: Camp
scene_ro2_hp_1.description: By the time you open your eyes again, your anxiety and exhaustion have long departed your body. You gather up your bags and continue exploring the unknown with your teammates.

scene_ro2_exchange_enter.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_enter.description: The overflowing dream-mists whisk you away from reality and usher you into a paradise beneath the sea, where your kin stand on the rusty hull of a sunken ship. They seem to be communicating about something, and you are surprised to discover that they seem to be individual entities rather than parts of a single collective. You cannot help but approach them, wanting to observe them in greater detail.

scene_ro2_exchange_1.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_1.description: There are no other races to communicate with, no need to imitate any language. This has always been your voice, flowing forth without any difficulty or inhibition, like the tide that has ebbed and flowed for thousands of years. Constant, without rush or delay, like the sound of weeping.

scene_ro2_exchange_2.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_2.description: Even the sea itself cannot block your voice. Only, when compared to the 'conversation' itself, these strange, drawn-out syllables you utter seem more like appoggiaturas to the dialogue, like an aria inserted between poetic dramas.

scene_ro2_exchange_3.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_3.description: You all seem to be able to communicate without speaking, messages passing between each other in incomprehensible forms.

scene_ro2_exchange_4.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_4.description: Adapt... transform... new rules... where are our limits... beyond the ocean...

scene_ro2_exchange_5.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_5.description: Evolve. Beyond all known forms, towards the most perfect answer. This is the most unrelenting instinct, the sole 'path.'

scene_ro2_exchange_6.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_6.description: Your deformed and exaggerated mouthparts seem to almost become new, independent organs; new limbs sprout from severed stumps, and what's more, your abnormally large body shape forces the passing currents to change their direction... Suddenly, you want to see what you look like.

scene_ro2_exchange_7.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_7.description: It is not the environment that is changing you, but rather, your changes are sculpting the environment... You will eventually transcend this land and sea and step into a new world.

scene_ro2_exchange_8.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_8.description: You approach your kin. Yes, you are a Seaborn, and there is nothing unusual about this. Rather, this identity fits you like a glove.

scene_ro2_exchange_9.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_9.description: The Seaborn group shifts to make room for you. They accept you. You are their kin. You are one of them.

scene_ro2_exchange_10.title: Meeting in a Dream
scene_ro2_exchange_10.description: Water drips onto the stalagmites. Water drips onto your face. You finally wake up.

scene_ro2_hp2_enter.title: Devouring Dust
scene_ro2_hp2_enter.description: The coast in front of you has already turned an ashen white, and when the sea wind blows, the debris of the earth dissipates along with it. Where soil seems to blur into dust, everything seems to be slowly burning away. You want to go take a closer look, but a man suddenly grabs you and hands you a protective suit. 'Put this on if you don't want to die.'

scene_ro2_hp2_1.title: Devouring Dust
scene_ro2_hp2_1.description: 'That is devouring dust, the Seaborns' newest trick. It decomposes everything, leaving only this fallow white ash behind. They are... preying on the land itself.' While the two of you talk, a piece of the land turns completely to ash and crumbles into the ocean. 'Stay away from the burn marks on the outer edges. You can't see those Sea Terrors right now, but you're a goner once they latch onto you. Go, stranger, and let the Inquisition bear this burden.'

scene_ro2_key_enter.title: Catastrophe Messenger
scene_ro2_key_enter.description: A Victorian-born Catastrophe Messenger is setting up beacon points high up along the coastline and adjusting the logging equipment. You happen to bump into him while he's fetching some water to drink, and he invites you for a cup of tea at his makeshift camp.

scene_ro2_key_1.title: Catastrophe Messenger
scene_ro2_key_1.description: The two of you start chatting in front of the campsite. He mentions how few people are willing to travel to Iberia to monitor Catastrophes, but he still came here alone knowing that there will always be people who need that information. He gives you a key as a token of this chance meeting.

scene_ro2_key_2.title: Catastrophe Messenger
scene_ro2_key_2.description: He is astounded that he could meet such a courteous person here! He offers you two keys to show his gratitude, but solemnly apologizes, thinking that his gift is of insufficient value.

scene_ro2_dice2_enter.title: Gathering Stormclouds
scene_ro2_dice2_enter.description: You've never seen such dense storm clouds before. The tempest forces its way across the ocean at an alarming rate, the Originium dust swept up in its vortex spinning violently as if intent on destroying everything, smashing the thick shells covering the ocean to pieces. You stare blankly at the storm raging in front of you, all the Catastrophe-monitoring instruments having failed. In the face of nature's onslaught, what can living creatures hope to achieve?

scene_ro2_dice2_1.title: Gathering Stormclouds
scene_ro2_dice2_1.description: The dark clouds roared forth and retreated without rhyme or reason. In a flash, it's as if the spectacle you just witnessed never took place at all. As soon as the gale winds subside, the shells float to the surface of the ocean and begin to clump together once more. Maybe one day, they really will be able to conquer nature. Hopefully, that day never comes.

scene_ro2_suit_enter.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_enter.description: You pass an old Iberian man, and can vaguely hear his entourage addressing him as 'Saint' in hushed voices. He stops you, full of suspicion as he questions you. Where did you come from? What are you doing? You answer his questions calmly and with grace, and his tone gradually softens. You return his questions, and though your eyes are on him, his gaze is fixed on the ocean behind you... 'Finally, someone has come to put an end to it.' It's about time, he says.

scene_ro2_suit_1.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_1.description: The old man provides you with a map of the local area, marks the places where you can obtain supplies, and tells you that foreigners best not linger here for too long.

scene_ro2_suit_2.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_2.description: Your lighting equipment has broken, and the night is fast approaching. The old man hesitates for a moment, then passes you the lantern in his hand. 'This was originally a collectible left behind by an old friend. Instead of letting it sink into the ocean with me, it ought to remain here on the land.'

scene_ro2_suit_3.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_3.description: The old man sees that your clothes are somewhat damaged, so he has his attendants bring you clean casualwear as well as some supplies, and pushes them into your hands.

scene_ro2_suit_4.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_4.description: You turn down the old man's goodwill, but solemnly thank him nevertheless.

scene_ro2_suit_5.title: Lonely Elder
scene_ro2_suit_5.description: You accept the old man's goodwill, and solemnly express your gratitude.

scene_ro2_trade4_enter.title: For Survival
scene_ro2_trade4_enter.description: After you earn the trust of the local sea people, they take you into a labyrinthine cave. The place winds deep underground and is filled with giant shelled creatures you've never seen before. The sea people are nervously at work prying open the shells of these creatures; as soon as they do so, the packages of flesh within spit out a large amount of secretions that are quickly collected, filtered, and packaged. Nobody says a word, trying to keep their motions as minimal and efficient as possible, keeping everything in order as if working in a secret factory.

scene_ro2_trade4_1.title: For Survival
scene_ro2_trade4_1.description: You finally figure out what is going on inside the cave. These giant shelled creatures are actually Sea Terror larvae, and the plaster made from their secretions can effectively confuse the Sea Terror swarm and avoid their pursuit... However, the smell is something atrocious.

scene_ro2_trade4_2.title: For Survival
scene_ro2_trade4_2.description: The collection procedure is not complicated, and you quickly get the hang of it. But on several occasions, when you see those packets of flesh turn desiccated and dry, you seem to hear a low-pitched sobbing sound... It is very faint, perhaps nothing more than the sound of a knife scraping against the hard shell. You can't say for sure.

scene_ro2_trade4_3.title: For Survival
scene_ro2_trade4_3.description: During a work break, you hear the sea people talking amongst themselves in hushed voices—another group of their companions responsible for bringing back the giant shelled creatures failed to return. This is a necessary sacrifice; everyone understands this in their heart, but they will not stop. There will always be those who have to pay the price so that more may survive. As for how long this method can continue, nobody can say for sure. After you depart, the sea people must continue to slink around in hopes of survival, but you have more important things to do.

scene_ro2_trade4_4.title: For Survival
scene_ro2_trade4_4.description: A swarm of Sea Terrors suddenly appears and attacks the cave. You quickly realize—were those faint tones the sounds of the shelled creatures calling out to the Sea Terrors? If so, not even a secluded cave like this can stop the transmission of information... You escape from the chaos, hoping that the sea people also made it out safely. Hope is all you can offer.

scene_ro2_7_enter.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_enter.description: Under the Inquisition's orders, certain sacraments of penance have already been merged with heavy manual labor. Everyone who completes the ritual will be rewarded, but honestly speaking... how can anyone pass a trial like this?

scene_ro2_7_1.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_1.description: While walking back and forth with sacks of food in your arms, you feel a surge of bliss well up within your heart. Want to keep going?

scene_ro2_7_2.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_2.description: Tilling the fields is hard work, but you feel as if you are getting stronger. Still down to do a bit more?

scene_ro2_7_3.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_3.description: The massive bell cannot be rung through a person's strength alone, and you have to make use of several devices to make it sound. The good news is, you found a key during that process. Are you sure you want to keep going?

scene_ro2_7_4.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_4.description: The Inquisitors hand you your reward, the priests sing your praises, and the distant watchtowers light up the night. Even though you are exhausted and out of breath, at this moment, your heart is filled with hope and eagerness.

scene_ro2_7_5.title: Path of Suffering
scene_ro2_7_5.description: You don't have that much confidence in your physical abilities. Maybe some other time.

scene_ro2_8_enter.title: Empathy
scene_ro2_8_enter.description: You sneak into a settlement of Church of the Deep cultists where Sea Terrors and humans seem to be coexisting in a delicate equilibrium. It seems that as long as you provide them enough food and don't show any signs of aggression, they aren't so scary after all. But... you already know without even having to think about it—the very act of feeding a Sea Terror... is extremely dangerous.

scene_ro2_8_1.title: Empathy
scene_ro2_8_1.description: The food is ready. Which kind of Sea Terror would you like to feed?

scene_ro2_8_2.title: Empathy
scene_ro2_8_2.description: This is extremely dangerous. If you're one step too slow, the Sea Terrors will devour the entire metal bucket in your hand. Are you sure you want to do this?

scene_ro2_8_3.title: Empathy
scene_ro2_8_3.description: Perhaps an Inquisitor will soon come to deal with this settlement, but you don't think you'll ever forget this astounding place.

scene_ro2_8_4.title: Empathy
scene_ro2_8_4.description: Sea Terrors don't have a very good grasp of action and consequence, and you are bitten ferociously while still getting the food ready. When you look at the cultists who are still feeding the Sea Terrors, you can't help but wonder, how did these people all come together to feed these alien creatures in the first place?

scene_ro2_9_enter.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_enter.description: An armory collapsed following an attack from Church of the Deep cultists, and the Inquisition has begun to survey the damage after repelling the enemy. Due to the extent of it, they are willing to sell you some of the salvaged materials to offset the loss.

scene_ro2_9_1.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_1.description: While rummaging around for usable items among the damaged supplies, you catch a glimpse of some pristine-condition items that were just salvaged, as well as a statue of a Saint. The Inquisitors are, without a doubt, acting on their convictions, but how about you? What is it that drives you?

scene_ro2_9_2.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_2.description: Money ought to be spent wisely.

scene_ro2_9_3.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_3.description: Eventually, you find something well-preserved in the pile of supplies, and leave contentedly.

scene_ro2_9_4.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_4.description: Finally, you find something usable in the pile of supplies.

scene_ro2_9_5.title: Faith
scene_ro2_9_5.description: You say goodbye to the Inquisitors and leave.

scene_ro2_10_enter.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_enter.description: You rescue an Iberian man who was entrapped by Sea Terrors, and he thanks you for your kindness and gratefully offers to repay you. Judging from the style of his robes, he appears to be an Iberian priest. However, you can't be entirely sure... since the local Church of the Deep cultists also wear similar attire.

scene_ro2_10_1.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_1.description: He affectionately calls you his friend and draws two boxes from his robes, beseeching you to choose one as your thank-you gift. Be it from the insignias on his clothing or the engravings on the boxes, you clearly recognize him as a member of the Inquisition.

scene_ro2_10_2.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_2.description: He affectionately calls you his friend and draws two waterlogged boxes from his robes, inviting you to choose one as your thank-you gift. The boxes are stamped with unfamiliar marks, but he says that they represent the most widespread faith in Iberia before he stops talking.

scene_ro2_10_3.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_3.description: How can you accept a gift simply for being in the right place to lend a helping hand? You wave your hand at the priest and immediately turn to leave; he stands there staring at your back in a daze, not uttering a word.

scene_ro2_10_4.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_4.description: You've always heard that Iberian believers recognize kindness and repay it accordingly, especially the particularly devout. Today, you've witnessed it.

scene_ro2_10_5.title: Neither Black Nor White
scene_ro2_10_5.description: You've always heard that Iberian believers recognize kindness and repay it accordingly, especially the particularly devout. Today, you've witnessed it. But... there seems to be something... not quite right...

scene_ro2_11_enter.title: Ocean's Legacy
scene_ro2_11_enter.description: Before the Profound Silence came, the high seas used to teem with tales of the pirates: they plundered the King's vessels and sailed circles around the Grand Armada. They looted all in their wake, and were sung of in legends as being even wealthier than entire countries, yet sometimes also stealing from the rich to give to the poor. But after the Profound Silence, these tales abruptly came to an end, along with Iberia's Golden Age. Now, you're convinced you've located a trove of pirate treasure, but can't help but be alarmed by cornucopia of jewels and baubles overflowing all around you.

scene_ro2_11_1.title: Ocean's Legacy
scene_ro2_11_1.description: You grab all the booty that appears valuable, though you can't exactly distinguish the real deal from cursed items meant to deceive treasure hunters. Rumors abound that during the final moments of the Profound Silence, some pirates chose to join hands with the Grand Armada to defend against foreign enemies, while others left the coast forever with their families. In any case, there are no longer any pirates in this era.

scene_ro2_11_2.title: Ocean's Legacy
scene_ro2_11_2.description: After grabbing the treasure that appears absolutely safe to take, you make your way out from this place.

scene_ro2_king_enter.title: King No More
scene_ro2_king_enter.description: You find an empty Iberian city, devoid of people and with no signs of Sea Terrors. In the middle of the city stands a magnificent museum. You study the nearly completely worn-away leaflets and discover that the museum was dedicated to the unsung kings of Iberia.

scene_ro2_king_1.title: King No More
scene_ro2_king_1.description: You don't see any treasure worth taking with you. Perhaps anything of value has long been taken by the royal retainers or the Inquisition... Besides, there are no statues of kings here at all, not even a name or a title. You can't help but start questioning the authenticity of the tidbits of information in this so-called museum.

scene_ro2_king_2.title: King No More
scene_ro2_king_2.description: After some digging around, you find a box. The stele next to it is engraved with the magnificent achievements of a bygone king. As for the treasure? This empty box is the treasure he left behind. Or rather, it is the impression of splendor he passed on to future generations. In that empty box lies the infinite respect the Iberian royal family has for the rulers of other countries.

scene_ro2_king_3.title: King No More
scene_ro2_king_3.description: After some digging around, you come up empty-handed, and have to head back with only the tattered leaflet as your bounty. These kings are far too removed from the current era: their names, titles, coats of arms, and corresponding artifacts all lost to history. All the Iberian people can do is to treat them as a collective whole, reciting the same few words over and over about how the ancient past shapes the present.

scene_ro2_king_4.title: King No More
scene_ro2_king_4.description: You aren't interested in Iberian history. The things that matter are real silver and gold.

scene_ro2_liar1_enter.title: Medic's Will
scene_ro2_liar1_enter.description: The coastline devours the land, and civilization decays along with it. Wisdom gives way to thaumaturgy, and ignorance shambles across the land. You meet a wandering Iberian medic on his own, picking herbs for his patients. He sees that you are 'well armed' and begs you to keep him safe. You agree.

scene_ro2_liar1_1.title: Medic's Will
scene_ro2_liar1_1.description: The two of you strike up a lively conversation, chatting about everything from the medicinal properties of herbs to the future of humanity. He is amazed by your vast knowledge and seems convinced that you will be able to make a difference. After some thought, he retrieves a few items from his pack and hands them to you. He says that they were once a saint's relics, and that after his soul returned to his hometown, the people of the village enshrined these objects as holy collectibles. However, the old saint's last wish was for them to be passed down, so that they may bring hope to Iberia instead of collecting dust on a shelf. When he sees you accept the items, he thanks you and heads back for his village.

scene_ro2_liar1_2.title: Medic's Will
scene_ro2_liar1_2.description: The herb harvesting goes smoothly, and the wandering medic finishes his work in no time. He hands you some of the medicinal herbs as a reward, before walking towards the nearest village.

scene_ro2_liar2_enter.title: Heart of a Fool
scene_ro2_liar2_enter.description: Inland, you meet the guards of one of the nearby villages. Their village is wracked with an affliction, and their holy collectibles were stolen for no reason. As a passing traveler, as long as you are able to solve their problems, you will forever be a friend to the village.

scene_ro2_liar2_1.title: Heart of a Fool
scene_ro2_liar2_1.description: The guards tense up as soon as they see the object you just produced. Their captain tells you that this is one of the old saint's relics, the spiritual backbone of the village—and it would collapse without it. It was stolen a few days ago, and they had just caught the thief—the same person you met earlier. He sizes you up, then looks back at the tied-up wandering medic, before motioning for the guards to surround you.

scene_ro2_liar2_2.title: Heart of a Fool
scene_ro2_liar2_2.description: You take out some of the medicinal herbs the wandering medic gave you and teach the guards how to apply them. You watch their faces turn to shock, befuddlement, then sudden realization, before their captain hurriedly tells his men to release the captured wandering medic. He regretfully admits that he had mistakenly arrested him under suspicion of being a thief from the Church of the Deep who stole the village's collectibles, and now assures you that he will keep him safe. You are also entitled to the gratitude and repayment of the village, and you decide to ask for––

scene_ro2_san1_enter.title: Worship the Flame
scene_ro2_san1_enter.description: You see a group of Iberian priests carrying around a huge furnace with a writhing and shrieking Sea Terror nailed to the inside. The head priest laments to you that all this destruction was wrought by the Seaborn, and claims that his congregation has found a weapon capable of slaying them all. All that's required is the flame—the Seaborn will have nowhere to run, and people afflicted by the Seaborn will be able to regain their original forms. You listen to his fervent preaching before turning your eyes to the Sea Terror that has ceased its struggling, an uneasiness welling up in your chest.

scene_ro2_san1_1.title: Worship the Flame
scene_ro2_san1_1.description: Amidst peals of ceremonial chants, the priests directly... light your operator on fire?! The operator howls in pain, and your mind reflexively leaps to the distorted appearance of the immolated Sea Terror and wonders if you've made the correct decision. Fortunately, the flames are quickly extinguished, and the operator makes a full recover after applying some plaster to the burn. However, you can't stop your brain from uncontrollably jumping to conjectures—what if your operator had run into this group alone...

scene_ro2_san1_2.title: Worship the Flame
scene_ro2_san1_2.description: You tell these fanatics that flames cannot completely destroy the Seaborn. The only thing this execution-by-immolation accomplishes is to make the Seaborn adapt faster and understand fire sooner. The priests are extremely dissatisfied by your words—they denounce you as a Church of the Deep cultist, and wish to throw you into the furnace for a trial by fire.

scene_ro2_san1_3.title: Worship the Flame
scene_ro2_san1_3.description: You see the strange group off and continue on your way. In this era of rampaging Seaborn, anything and everything that can cause harm to them is doomed to be enshrined and worshipped... until the Seaborn adapts to them, until they lose their effectiveness. At which point, what else would remain to support the shattered spirit of humanity? You run through a few possibilities in your mind before moving on.

scene_ro2_bat1_enter.title: Booty Bay
scene_ro2_bat1_enter.description: You search around for the riches buried here, but the treasure has been concealed by vegetation and soil. How are you supposed to get at it?

scene_ro2_bat1_1.title: Booty Bay
scene_ro2_bat1_1.description: After hearing you sound the horn, the awakened 'locals' come out to 'warmly welcome' your arrival. Surely they will be willing to help you find the treasure after you defeat them.

scene_ro2_bat1_2.title: Booty Bay
scene_ro2_bat1_2.description: You decide not to go looking for trouble. Safety first, after all.

scene_ro2_bat2_enter.title: Dancing Chests
scene_ro2_bat2_enter.description: A group of Sarkaz are singing and dancing around various treasure chests, several of which are opening and closing along with the dance. The Sarkaz don't seem hostile, and you might even be able to join in for a bit of fun and relaxation. One of the dancers twirls and pirouettes to your side, trying to drag you into their dance.

scene_ro2_bat2_1.title: Dancing Chests
scene_ro2_bat2_1.description: The dancer pulls you close to the pile of treasure chests, and you suddenly see a Sea Terror mimicking the shape of a gold coin inside one. It suddenly dawns upon you that this group of Sarkaz is most likely with the Church of the Deep! When you turn around, they've already drawn their weapons and are glaring at you maliciously.

scene_ro2_bat2_2.title: Dancing Chests
scene_ro2_bat2_2.description: You dodge the dancer's outstretched hands and simply watch the Sarkaz dance from a distance. You don't want to delve into dumb questions about why there are Sarkaz in Iberia; you simply want to watch other people dance and relax before continuing onward to face the hardships that lie ahead.

scene_ro2_t1_enter.title: Puppy-Dog Eyes
scene_ro2_t1_enter.description: A Perro is quietly tailing your squad, seemingly trying to make contact with you. But when you try to get close to him, he just hides far, far away. You have no idea what exactly he's trying to do, but the sound of his sobbing won't stop ringing in your ears. It's maddening.

scene_ro2_t1_1.title: Puppy-Dog Eyes
scene_ro2_t1_1.description: In any case, this Perro has to go. Right now, this instant, immediately!

scene_ro2_t1_2.title: Puppy-Dog Eyes
scene_ro2_t1_2.description: Your group picks up the pace and takes a few detours, and eventually, the irritating sobbing sound fades away.

scene_ro2_t2_enter.title: Duckforce Test
scene_ro2_t2_enter.description: Civilization here is on the decline, and even a mountain of gold can hardly buy you a few supplies... Hold on a sec, is that Duck Lord? And he's trying to do business with Church of the Deep cultists?!

scene_ro2_t2_1.title: Duckforce Test
scene_ro2_t2_1.description: Your enemy's friend is also your enemy, and this duck has stepped out of line.

scene_ro2_t2_2.title: Duckforce Test
scene_ro2_t2_2.description: As long as these cultists don't go out of their way to attack you, there's no need to get in the way of their deal.

scene_ro2_t3_enter.title: Some Time to Kill
scene_ro2_t3_enter.description: While your team is resting, you run into Duck Lord who is yet again in the middle of business negotiations. His bodyguard, Gopnik, is humming an Ursine ditty to himself. Maybe you can find something for him to do?

scene_ro2_t3_1.title: Some Time to Kill
scene_ro2_t3_1.description: You raise your fists, and Gopnik starts walking towards you waving his fists as well.

scene_ro2_t3_2.title: Some Time to Kill
scene_ro2_t3_2.description: After Duck Lord finishes his business, Gopnik leaves with him.

scene_ro2_t4_enter.title: A Passion for Work?
scene_ro2_t4_enter.description: That Perro showed up again, except this time, he's standing in front of you as if trying hard to tell you something. Unfortunately, he stands there hesitating for what must be eons, not uttering a single word. You let out a sigh, and go up to grab the piece of paper from his hand yourself... Alright, let's take a look... It's a self-rights and responsibilities contract... from Duck Lord?

scene_ro2_t4_1.title: A Passion for Work?
scene_ro2_t4_1.description: You have every reason to suspect that the guy in front of you is messing with you, and the damn sobbing makes you even angrier.

scene_ro2_t4_2.title: A Passion for Work?
scene_ro2_t4_2.description: You sigh, make up some platitudes to fool him with, and send him on his way. It's not easy to find a job these days, let alone for such a taciturn person.

scene_ro2_t5_enter.title: Business Empire?
scene_ro2_t5_enter.description: Duck Lord appears in front of you with his new employee, and he wants you to leave this place for a simple reason—his 'business partner' takes issue with you, and your presence is preventing him from making money.

scene_ro2_t5_1.title: Business Empire?
scene_ro2_t5_1.description: This duck's really pushing his luck. Time to teach him a little lesson.

scene_ro2_t5_2.title: Business Empire?
scene_ro2_t5_2.description: After seeing you acquiesce to his demands, Duck Lord swaggers away with his underlings in tow.

scene_ro2_ent1_enter.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_enter.description: You find a high-tech box the size of a coffee table sitting along the coast. After you give all its buttons a good press, it spits out a pamphlet with a catalogue of its various products. Apparently, this is some kind of lotto machine that floated here from Ægir. It appears to support six or seven different payment methods, but due to environmental constraints, you are only able to use the most primitive one: sticking in coins.

scene_ro2_ent1_1.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_1.description: The internal mechanisms whirr over and over, making various mechanical sounds, and the machine soon returns to its original state. You now know that this device is an amazing printer of sorts, and all its prizes are printed right here on the spot.

scene_ro2_ent1_2.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_2.description: The machine lets out a roar, and its parts whirl wildly as it starts printing out an object. You see that it is a micro-carved pearl amulet which, according to the pamphlet, can modify a person's aura at a molecular level to make them more confident and bestow them with good luck.

scene_ro2_ent1_3.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_3.description: The machine lets out a roar, and its parts whirl wildly as it starts printing out an object. You see that it is a set of educational toys. According to the pamphlet, as traditional keys and lockpicking equipment have been more or less replaced by advanced encryption and decryption technology, they are now no more than toys.

scene_ro2_ent1_4.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_4.description: The machine lets out a roar, and its parts whirl wildly as it starts printing out an object. You see that it is an artisan handkerchief. According to the pamphlet, this item is made to be silky yet tough, sturdy enough to protect a maiden's heart.

scene_ro2_ent1_5.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_5.description: The machine lets out a roar, and its parts whirl wildly as it starts printing out an object. You don't even need to read the pamphlet to know what this item does.

scene_ro2_ent1_6.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_6.description: The machine lets out a roar, and its parts whirl wildly as... nothing happens?!

scene_ro2_ent1_7.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_7.description: While you wait for the results, huge waves begin to rise from the ocean, forcing you to hurriedly seek shelter. When you go back to inspect the lotto machine, you discover that it was smashed and carried away by the tides, leaving behind an extremely valuable energy core.

scene_ro2_ent1_8.title: Buy Now, Print Now
scene_ro2_ent1_8.description: The machine seems to detect that you are about to leave, and spits out a coin at you. Seeing this, you go back and forth several times to nab a few coins from the machine. By the time you try for your fifth coin, you find that the machine has already blacklisted you.

scene_ro2_sacrifice_enter.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_enter.description: An Ægir rescues you from being swarmed by Sea Terrors and takes you to a secluded sanctuary. Heavy rain falls outside the window, and you see no signs of fire anywhere along the entire horizon. The sole source of light comes from the faint lantern in the Ægir's hand. His sanctuary seems to have a lot of equipment left behind by the Inquisition. He notices that these items have piqued your interest, and suggests he'd be willing to exchange them for the supplies you've gathered outside.

scene_ro2_sacrifice_1.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_1.description: 'Thanks for bringing all this good stuff, friend. I haven't seen crafts as fine as these since the lighthouse collapsed. Please make yourself at home and rest well. Once the sky clears and the Sea Terrors leave, I'll point you to a safe route.'

scene_ro2_sacrifice_2.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_2.description: 'Thank you, honored guest. I believe the two of us will be able to exchange information over a sip of clean water. What do you think?'

scene_ro2_sacrifice_3.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_3.description: 'Compadre, have you been satisfied with your visit home? If we join hands, surely we'll be able to survive through this era. Please come with me to my lab in a little bit; I have some technology that may help you avoid the Sea Terrors' pursuit. What? You've seen a new form of Seaborn? Excellent, can you describe it for me?!'

scene_ro2_sacrifice_4.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_4.description: You spend a night in the sanctuary safe and sound, and on the next day, after the Sea Terrors have left, you thank him and depart as well.

scene_ro2_sacrifice_5.title: Mutual Aid
scene_ro2_sacrifice_5.description: After seeing that you have no intention of trading with him, he also stops talking. After the Sea Terrors outside the sanctuary leave, you thank him and depart as well.

scene_ro2_teleport_enter.title: At a Glance
scene_ro2_teleport_enter.description: Fragments of the forest of monoliths are being assimilated by the nethersea brand, sinking next to the withered giant. Their inscriptions constantly change, showing a myriad of possibilities: You become the partner of a woman you know, or you become her mortal enemy; you lead mankind to fight the Seaborn, or you lead the Seaborn as one of their own; you stand on Terra to gaze at the stars, or you stand on ■■■ to gaze at Terra. You want to keep investigating, but Mizuki motions for you to stop for now. The nethersea brand is constantly analyzing information. What you have read, we many will also know.

scene_ro2_teleport_1.title: At a Glance
scene_ro2_teleport_1.description: Your attempts soon pay off, and the branded stele brings your consciousness to a period of time that the Seaborn may have experienced. Until surviving to the end of this fragment, you must make decisions on behalf of the Seaborn.

scene_ro2_teleport_2.title: At a Glance
scene_ro2_teleport_2.description: Mizuki changes the nethersea brand's behavioral patterns, and it begins to draw upon the information, violently consuming energy to change its material form. In the end, the branded stele completely disappears, and a familiar object appears in Mizuki's hands. He does not say anything, but smiles as he places it into your palm.

scene_ro2_task_enter.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_task_enter.description: You switch on the communication terminal and find that Tulip has sent you three messages. Judging from their titles, they seem to be three urgent commissions with different degrees of difficulty. As Rhodes Island's branch leader in Iberia, she needs to make full use of the resources at her disposal to ensure the survival of the Infected. Even if you are busy with other important matters, she will still issue these commissions to you after careful deliberation.

scene_ro2_task_1.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_task_1.description: You tap on the message, and the commission's contents are downloaded onto the terminal's display. At the end is a small line of text: 'Rhodes Island's nearby squads are on standby and ready to offer support. Please be careful.'

scene_ro2_task_2.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_task_2.description: You tap on the message, and the commission's contents are downloaded onto the terminal's display. At the end is a small line of text: 'Work carefully. Don't let bad luck get the better of you.'

scene_ro2_task_3.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_task_3.description: You tap on the message, and the commission's contents are downloaded onto the terminal's display. At the end is a small line of text: 'Even odd jobs put food on the table, so do your best.'

scene_ro2_task_4.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_task_4.description: You are so focused on the problems in front of you that you don't have the time to take on additional commissions.

scene_ro2_expedition_enter.title: Emergency Dispatch
scene_ro2_expedition_enter.description: A batch of support supplies have arrived at the nearest safe house. You need to decide whether to have Logistics transfer them over, or to send over your operators who are familiar with the area.

scene_ro2_expedition_1.title: Emergency Dispatch
scene_ro2_expedition_1.description: Your chosen operator finishes getting ready, then leaves the team to head towards the safe house.

scene_ro2_expedition_2.title: Emergency Dispatch
scene_ro2_expedition_2.description: The logistics personnel are professional and efficient, and you feel confident leaving the material transport task in their hands.

scene_ro2_taskreward1_enter.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward1_enter.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward1_2.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward1_2.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward1_3.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward1_3.description: 'It might not be much, but these supplies should allow you to survive in Iberia a few days longer.'

scene_ro2_taskreward2_enter.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward2_enter.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward2_1.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward2_1.description: 'Cherish this gift that you've fought hard for.'

scene_ro2_taskreward2_2.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward2_2.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward3_enter.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward3_enter.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward3_1.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward3_1.description: 'It might not be much, but these supplies should allow you to survive in Iberia a few days longer.'

scene_ro2_taskreward3_2.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward3_2.description: Commission complete. Please collect the rewards.

scene_ro2_taskreward3_3.title: Tulip's Commission
scene_ro2_taskreward3_3.description: 'Cherish this gift that you've fought hard for.'

scene_ro2_bossa1_enter.title: Delusions of Lunacy
scene_ro2_bossa1_enter.description: The flames in the sky burn wantonly, turning into a faint residual warmth when they land on the knight's shoulderguards. He goads his mount and gallops atop the waves. He gazes out, and there is nothing but pure azure all around him, the sound of rushing waves ever incessant. The ears of wheat are calling.

scene_ro2_bossa1_1.title: Delusions of Lunacy
scene_ro2_bossa1_1.description: The wheat seeds are sown into the ocean, and the ocean drowns them. The merciless ocean slaughters wantonly and rejects life. Life needs the knight, and the knight shall charge forward! Slay the ocean! Slay the ocean!!

scene_ro2_bossa1_2.title: Delusions of Lunacy
scene_ro2_bossa1_2.description: The tides overwhelm the waves of wheat, the raging wind whips the knight; he roars, but the ocean does not answer.

scene_ro2_bossa2_enter.title: The Knight Persists
scene_ro2_bossa2_enter.description: A windless day, the ocean's surface as serene as a mirror. The knight smashes the mirror underfoot and looks at his reflection, seeing only an illusion of himself treading across the sky, eyes cast down upon the masses. The knight lifts his lance to thrust, and his fake points his weapon at the sea. Suddenly, the ocean caves in and a storm rushes forth, the sea and sky joining forces to kill the knight. Civilization despises him, yet nature also rejects him. The name of his enemy, is Terra.

scene_ro2_bossa2_1.title: The Knight Persists
scene_ro2_bossa2_1.description: The steed neighs, and the knight roars. Despicable fate does not show its face, but instead sends this shapeless servant to hinder him. But it matters not, it matters not. They have come, and the knight will destroy them.

scene_ro2_bossa2_2.title: The Knight Persists
scene_ro2_bossa2_2.description: The knight leaps up, but comes crashing down heavily. The shadows lurking within the tides—are they kin? ...They summon the tides forth; they seek to bring the knight to his knees! He rises to the surface and leaps back out, again and again. Grovel? Admit defeat? Never. Never! The knight is his own master. He always holds his head high!

scene_ro2_bossb1_enter.title: The Beginning
scene_ro2_bossb1_enter.description: The world is undergoing drastic changes. The news terminals will not stop beeping, and bad news continues to spill forth: the Sea Terrors are marching towards land, the Penal Battalion's fleet has been destroyed, and the Church of the Deep cultists have advanced on the Bastión de Cánticos. However, what worries you most is news of the Hunters who entered the Stultifera Navis. Mizuki found documents detailing plans to lure the Abyssal Hunters back into the ocean to resurrect Him. And another document, titled 'Caerula,' records a bishop's lifelong research on the Seaborn, as well as a certain location.

scene_ro2_bossb1_1.title: The Beginning
scene_ro2_bossb1_1.description: It's already too late to notify your Rhodes Island or Iberian allies. You must dive into the abyss with Mizuki, dig out the secrets left behind by the bishop, and use this knowledge to repel the Seaborn and save the Abyssal Hunters.

scene_ro2_bossb1_2.title: The Beginning
scene_ro2_bossb1_2.description: Thankfully, it was only a dream. After you wake up, you check your communications terminal. By all that is holy, thank goodness that nothing happened.

scene_ro2_bossb2_enter.title: Caerula Animus
scene_ro2_bossb2_enter.description: A gargantuan corpse lies at the location marked at the map. A large colony of Sea Terrors gathers around it, devouring its forever-growing remains. Mizuki leads you around them, towards the inside of the corpse. After fumbling around in the darkness for a long time, the two of you finally find traces of civilization. A dust-sealed laboratory long lost to time awaits its guests. Mizuki cannot open the heavy, worn doors, but the surveillance equipment unlocks them after recognizing your faces. Since the Bishop of the Deep was convinced that this was the source of the Seaborn, this primordial power can surely help you save the Abyssal Hunters. You and Mizuki begin to search the laboratory.

scene_ro2_bossb2_1.title: Caerula Animus
scene_ro2_bossb2_1.description: The plants around the garden are flourishing. Were it not for Mizuki's reminder, you'd surely have reached out to touch these plant-like Sea Terrors. In the center of the garden, a large tree rises from the ground and stretches beyond the laboratory's confines. Mizuki tells you that this is His core organ. In theory, He has long since died, but sheer survival instinct still drives Him to grow, thus nourishing we many. If he assimilates it, Mizuki can become His new will and help you stop the bishop's plans. You watch him touch the tree's bark, before he gradually sinks into the trunk. Not long afterwards, He emerges once more. The entire laboratory trembles with His awakening. He opens His eyes and looks at you. Thus He speaks: 'Ishar-mla, will be stopped.'

scene_ro2_bossb2_2.title: Caerula Animus
scene_ro2_bossb2_2.description: A few items that have survived tens of thousands of years may be exactly what you need to save the Hunters.

scene_ro2_bossb2_3.title: Caerula Animus
scene_ro2_bossb2_3.description: There might've been something of vital importance hiding within the laboratory, but you decide not to touch it.

scene_ro2_bossb3_enter.title: Paean
scene_ro2_bossb3_enter.description: You find an area next to His lair that is untouched by the Seaborn. There is nothing inside but ocean sand, a broken figure of a man, and a pair of sleeping beauties still clutching their weapons.

scene_ro2_bossb3_1.title: Paean
scene_ro2_bossb3_1.description: Even in their final moments, the Abyssal Hunters closed their eyes as human beings, not Seaborn. After you leave, the Sea Terrors do not invade—a scar forever carved into the body of we many. They will not remember the appearances of these Hunters, only that this place must not be entered, ever.

BATTLE_NORMAL.name: Combat Ops
BATTLE_NORMAL.description: Everyone has their weapons drawn. They're definitely not here to negotiate.

BATTLE_ELITE.name: Emergency Ops
BATTLE_ELITE.description: Some violence may well exceed your expectations, a very common occurrence.

BATTLE_BOSS.name: Dreadful Foe
BATTLE_BOSS.description: Criminals, ruffians, and the damned… You're in trouble.

REST.name: Safe House
REST.description: Nobody will bother you here, and there's plenty of food and water. No need to be so tense all the time.

INCIDENT.name: Encounter
INCIDENT.description: New friends, old rivals… Strange encounters never age. Only scars stand the test of time.

ENTERTAINMENT.name: Downtime Recreation
ENTERTAINMENT.description: A little indulgence in life's simpler pleasures goes a long way in fighting the monotonous and the harrowing on your long road ahead.

UNKNOWN.name: Dense Fog
UNKNOWN.description: There's something in the mist, but you cannot see anything...

WISH.name: Wish Fulfilled
WISH.description: There are many ways of making a wish, but the wish itself is almost always the same thing.

SACRIFICE.name: Fortuitous Opportunity
SACRIFICE.description: The lighthouse has fallen. People open their bags, delivering light for each other.

EXPEDITION.name: Emergency Dispatch
EXPEDITION.description: A lantern cannot illuminate without oil, a fincatching boat cannot sail without fuel. Do not underestimate the importance of adequate supplies.

BATTLE_SHOP.name: Rogue Trader
BATTLE_SHOP.description: Neither an ally nor an enemy. Some people like to sit on the fence.

PORTAL.name: Wander into Wonderland
PORTAL.description: And thus the bard sings: 'Oft are desolate fields and floral gardens neighbors; oft is losing one's way but another adventure.'

MISSION.name: Regional Commissions
MISSION.description: The long road is unfinished; the only ending you see is a new signpost.

rogue_2_variation_1.functionDesc: This floor has 2 additional nodes, but twice as much Light will be lost

rogue_2_variation_2.functionDesc: On this floor, all your units and non-Boss units gain +50 ASPD, and your units receive -70% healing effectiveness

rogue_2_variation_3.functionDesc: On this floor, you will obtain 3 Originium Ingots every time you enter a non-combat node, but will lose all Originium Ingots gained on this floor after exiting

rogue_2_variation_4.functionDesc: Battles on this floor drop +100% Originium Ingots; upon entering a combat node, you will immediately lose 1 Life Point (Cannot drop below 1 from this effect)

rogue_2_variation_5.functionDesc: Battles on this floor have a 30% chance to drop a Recruitment Voucher; all enemy units have +15 RES

rogue_2_variation_6.functionDesc: Battles on this floor grant +50% Command EXP; all enemy units have +50% DEF

rogue_2_variation_7.functionDesc: After the end of each battle on this floor, gain 1 Max Life Point; however, Life Point and Shield losses are doubled

rogue_2_variation_8.functionDesc: The first Wish Fulfilled node you enter on this floor will grant 1 random collectible, but you will no longer be able to identify node types beyond the nodes directly ahead of you

rogue_2_mutation_1.functionDesc: Operators with this Rejection will continuously lose HP whenever their HP is not full
rogue_2_mutation_1.desc: Accelerated blood cell apoptosis, inhibited bone marrow hematopoiesis

rogue_2_mutation_2.functionDesc: Operators with this Rejection will automatically activate their skill
rogue_2_mutation_2.desc: Impairment of sensory functions, loss of coordination, loss of control over stress mechanisms

rogue_2_mutation_3.functionDesc: Operators with this Rejection will be Frozen for 15 seconds after deployment
rogue_2_mutation_3.desc: Atrophy of neurons in the brain, delayed reactions, dissociated consciousness

rogue_2_mutation_4.functionDesc: Operators with this Rejection have -50% Max HP, ATK, DEF, Deployment Cost, and Redeployment Time
rogue_2_mutation_4.desc: External cells observed in circulatory system, ectopic electrical signaling, whole-body tissue spasms

rogue_2_mutation_5.functionDesc: Operators lose HP at a faster rate when their HP is not full, but gain increased ATK based on how low their HP is
rogue_2_mutation_5.desc: Accelerated blood cell apoptosis, inhibited bone marrow hematopoiesis

rogue_2_mutation_6.functionDesc: All Operators will automatically activate their skills, and while no skill is active, have gradually increased ATK and gradually decreased ASPD; this effect resets when the skill duration ends
rogue_2_mutation_6.desc: Impairment of sensory functions, loss of coordination, loss of control over stress mechanisms

rogue_2_mutation_7.functionDesc: Operators will be Frozen for 30s after deployment, but gain +200% ATK and DEF for the duration
rogue_2_mutation_7.desc: Atrophy of neurons in the brain, delayed reactions, dissociated consciousness

rogue_2_mutation_8.functionDesc: Operators have -75% Max HP, ATK, DEF, Deployment Cost, and Redeployment Time, but start with +80 SP
rogue_2_mutation_8.desc: External cells observed in circulatory system, ectopic electrical signaling, whole-body tissue spasms

rogue_2_virtue_1.functionDesc: For 30 seconds after the start of battle, all enemies have -30% ATK and Movement Speed
rogue_2_virtue_1.desc: 'The peal of winter's thunder is the victory cry of Ursus.'

rogue_2_virtue_2.functionDesc: The Operator on the battlefield with the highest HP will restore an additional 2 SP per second
rogue_2_virtue_2.desc: 'Time is like a loom, weaving Yan's majestic mountains and rivers.'

rogue_2_virtue_3.functionDesc: Gain an additional 70 Command EXP at the end of the next battle (One-time only)
rogue_2_virtue_3.desc: 'In a land shackled by the past, Columbia is already crafting the future.'

rogue_2_virtue_4.functionDesc: The Operator on the battlefield with the lowest HP percentage restores 50 HP per second
rogue_2_virtue_4.desc: 'As long as nature continues to breathe, Sami's bloodline will not run dry.'

rogue_2_virtue_5.functionDesc: All friendly melee units have +35% Physical and Arts Dodge
rogue_2_virtue_5.desc: 'History has borne witness to Victoria's ascent, and it shall continue to do so.'

rogue_2_virtue_6.functionDesc: All friendly ranged units have +300 DEF and +30 RES
rogue_2_virtue_6.desc: 'Without art or emotion in our hearts, what difference is there between us and metal crabs?'

rogue_2_virtue_7.desc: 'The riches of the golden city fell to wind and sand, and thus Sargon came to glitter brightly.'

rogue_2_virtue_11.functionDesc: The Operator on the battlefield with the lowest HP percentage restores 100 HP per second

MAIN: Good morning, good afternoon, and good night.
You give me the Originium, and I give you the goods. Don't worry about the details.
We may be old friends, but business is business.
Why am I helping you? Think of it as an investment.
Rhodes Island is a business, and I'm a businessman. See, we're two of a kind.
This isn't scavenging, I just take treasures nobody else wanted.
You want to hear a story? Anytime, my friend, but good tales don't come cheap.
We meet again, friend. What are you buying this time?
Long time no see, old friend. Good to know you're still alive and kicking.
The sea is full of adventures and riches alike. You've come to the right place.
I do happen to have a few clients here, though you usually refer to them as 'cultists.'
The sea is full of adventures and riches alike. You've come to the right place.
I do happen to have a few clients here, though you usually refer to them as 'cultists.'
RECRUIT_TICKET: You need manpower? I got you. No need to hesitate.
Take my advice, old friend, and don't get along too well with the sea creatures.
'Iberia has already fallen to Silence. Is this an omen of the land's future?'
Be careful of any Columbian organizations with 'Maylander' in the name.
This is way cheaper than having your boss look all over the place for a Messenger.
You guys at Rhodes Island have all sorts of weirdos, huh...
I know, I know, everyone has their own business to attend to.
You need help, but that help's not going to come free.
Mind if I have a look-see at Rhodes Island's aircraft? No? Too bad.
If you're looking for a fighter, the Sarkaz and Blacksteel are both good options.
Life in the barrens is full of pain. Surviving's not easy.
Take my advice, old friend, and don't get along too well with the sea creatures.
'Iberia has already fallen to Silence. Is this an omen of the land's future?'
RELIC: Don't worry. Money makes the world go round.
Don't be picky, it wasn't easy gathering all this scrap.
An armed society is a polite society.
What's this thing good for? Why, buy it and find out!
They say Laterano's a place without conflict or hatred. Do you buy that? I sure don't.
Gaul is long gone, but its remnants are still driving many to run the gauntlet.
I once bought a whole crate of Honey Biscuits, but this Perro girl made off with the lot of them.
You want to travel deep into the Sami tundra? Even the Empire of Ursus knows to stay far away from there.
For every ten Siracusans you bump into, about five are part of a 'Famiglia.' Watch yourself.
I don't understand the Seaborn or Sea Terrors, but I don't expect them to understand us either.
That friend you're traveling with is very peculiar... Of course, maybe that's just me overthinking things.
That friend you're traveling with is very peculiar... Of course, maybe that's just me overthinking things.
I don't understand the Seaborn or Sea Terrors, but I don't expect them to understand us either.
ACTIVE_TOOL: Be prepared for anything. Better safe than sorry, friend.
This little thing is equal parts worthless and terrifying...
What's this thing for? Good question, I don't know either.
BANK_ENTRY: Check out this new toy. The Prospective Investment System. Use your extra riches to pave the way for the future.
Always try take the long view. Money can buy infinite possibilities. That's a good thing, my friend.
This is the kind of stuff Columbian entrepreneurs love peddling! Capitalism, ho!
BANK_INVEST: You're an optimistic one. Try your hand at investing in the future, and you won't regret it, friend.
Don't resist the urge to splurge. That's money's not doing anything for you in your wallet.
BANK_WITHDRAWAL: Now's the time to be thanking your past self for your foresight. Am I right, friend?
There's always a return on investment. Well, not really, but everyone like to think so.
A little investment here and there'll eventually help you overcome anything. Can't hurt, anyway.
BANK_FAULTY: There's a withdrawal limit, but I'm willing to free up some space to bring you more practical goods. Thanks for always being so understanding, my friend.
BANK_REWARD_UNLOCK: Your investment reserves have gone up, friend. It's a good thing.
With your investment reserves, you can set out on your adventures with confidence.
Wonderful! Your next adventure will go much more smoothly. Probably.
Ah, I can see right away you're a cautious one. Maybe a little too cautious.
OUTER_NORMAL: I only take a small commission for your investments in future adventures. It's a fair deal.
There's a saying in Yan: 'Plan ahead, or plan to fail.' The Yanese have a point.
I got myself some new trinkets. You'll love them.
You should invest in your upcoming adventures!
OUTER_REWARD: I do thank you for your support, friend. Let's keep working together.
FIGHT_BOSS: The value of my wares will go down if you leave too many fingerprints on them, my friend.
Hand me the Originium Ingots first, you can touch that all you like.
Don't like my wares? Prices giving you second thoughts? How about rolling the die?
Oh, do be careful. You break it, you buy it.

ro2_ending_1.name: Precious Days
ro2_ending_1.desc: In the end, the goal envisioned from the very beginning is brought to fruition, and the two creatures, from Seaborn to human, are ready to usher in a new tomorrow after a full meal. Everyday life is the greatest joy that fate bestows upon the living, and indeed, peaceful days are the most joyous of all.
ro2_ending_1.changeEndingDesc: The ocean has no more knights, and Mizuki is able to return to his journey.

ro2_ending_2.name: Age of the Silence
ro2_ending_2.desc: In silence the terrible waves rise, and within it disappears the knight's howl. The calamity that once destroyed Iberia surges again, and this time it shall not recede.
ro2_ending_2.changeEndingDesc: The ocean is the enemy of the knight, and it has already soaked its way into your clothes.

ro2_ending_3.name: Price of Peace
ro2_ending_3.desc: The conflict over the 'Firstborn' comes to an end, and the human Him triumphs over the inhuman Him. The Silence fades, the tides retreat, and the being known as Mizuki shall never again return to the land.
ro2_ending_3.changeEndingDesc: Undercurrents surge beneath the tide; the blood of the 'Firstborn' leads Skadi back to We Many, and the Silence draws near.
